title: Where is support?
body: I looked for a way to ask support in the app but couldn’t find a place to do so. I’ve been a member for quite a while now. It’s by far the best carb tracking app that I’ve found and I’ve tried 5 or 6 of them. I keep coming back here. I pay for premium even. However I’m really frustrated. I’m having a hard time entering recipes. After I get all the info typed in there is many times no “save” option. I have to click the upper right corner to get out of the screen and so lose everything I’m trying to save. I try to refresh the screen, I poke around at the top of the screen (where it’s just white space), I clear out the food search history - nothing.  It’s hard enough for me to be faithful in tracking and with things like this happening quite often I’d rather just quit. This needs to be fixed. I’ve invested enough time and money with this app that I don’t want to throw in the towel, but this is annoying!!  The other annoyance is if I make a typo I can’t correct it or add a word in the middle of a line without completely starting over. The cursor automatically takes me to the end of the sentence. E.g if I want “ground cinnamon” and I forget to type ground or if I type grnd I can’t just jump in to correct it, I have to erase the entire line and start over. SO annoying. Each extra keystroke takes time that I don’t want to devote to tracking. I need it to be easy!  I love the scan feature. I wish all ingredients could be scanned.
response: Hi there, thanks for contacting us and for using Carb Manager! Our friendly support team would be delighted to assist you with your questions. To contact the team, please go to Settings > Contact Support, or send an email to support@carbmanager.com. We're here to help!

title: An amazing tool
body: I have had a great experience using this app. It’s easy to use, and is on my cell phone — so, I can update or edit my food intake and track my protein, carb, fat, and calorie intake through out the day. It has been easy to find and match the foods that I eat which makes it easy to be accurate and personalized about my exact food intake. It’s also very user friendly vehicle so it allows me to easily see if a particular food that I may be consider for consumption will fit into the limits/goals — that I’ve intentionally chosen for myself since it has a display panel that shows the maximum amount of calories, proteins, carbs, and fats that I’ve decided to consume daily. I am currently using this as a weight loss tool because, I unfortunately had put on 30lbs during the current Covid worldwide pandemic. I’m excited to say that I’ve already lost 7lbs is just 10 days. I have lost this weight without starving myself at all. I can also track my activities, exercising, and water intake too. I can’t wait to continue — and I plan to loose all my covid weight gain. I plan to use this app even after I reach my goal weight — because, my body thrives on a moderate calorie, low carb, high protein diet that incorporates good fats. I love how the program has notations about keto friendly foods. I also hope to eventually use the many great recipes that are linked to this site. Hip hip hooray to the help that this app offers with regard to healthy eating. Thank you!

title: Great tool for a Keto Diet!
body: I love this because you can track all of your macros quickly and easily. I love the ability to scan UPC codes to enter a new product. I love how you can enter recipes by entering a url. There are tons of recipes and you can edit recipes to suit your needs. There are meal plans included in the premium version but none of them suit my needs. They should be labeled differently than meal plan 1 etc so we do not have to look through each one. You can customize a meal plan which is great but it did not work for me. I entered “no seafood “ and it gave me only 1 choice for lunch which was an Asian salmon salad.

title: Really liking the revamp
body: I looked at carb manager before the Regan and just couldn’t get into it. I really like what they have done, you can tell that they put a lot of thought and hard work into their new and improved app. I love how easy it is to enter foods the barcode scanner has worked crazy fast for me with everything I’ve scanned so far. There’s tons of metrics you can teac track which is a huge plus for me because now I can have it all in one app instead of flipping through 3 like I did before. I can enter my blood glucose & ketone readings and it calculates my GKI. I can keep track of my body measurements to see how I’m progressing over time along with my weight. There’s just so much! It’s great. There are some bugs that still need to be worked out and crashing on the build a meal plan portion. I also wish that you didn’t have to pick a date to start your meal plan or so much food before moving on to the next step. The social aspect is nice, because it’s always enjoyable to run ideas past others on the same journey. Also the fact that they have recipes in app is awesome. Though I wish there was a dedicated spot for favorited recipes and the ability to create a shopping list from the favorites. I mean if we can make a meal plan shopping list why not make that feature available too. All in all this has been the perfect app for me. I hope they keep with these great improvements. Subbed to premium I liked everything so much.

title: Makes it easy to track and instill habits !
body: I recently made the decision to try the keto diet. Many friends swear by it, and I see how people with epilepsy May benefit from it. As someone with epilepsy I decided to give it a go and see all the hype not tracking anything at first and I definitely felt like I needed something to keep me accountable and on track. I tried another app, but they only let you log 5 things in the free version before you must pay. For someone trying it out and trying keto I don’t want to pay especially in the beginning.

title: 5-stars if you’re ready to upgrade to Premium
body: Carb Manager has been a wonderfully useful app for me. The interface is extremely user friendly, it has great visuals that keep it from looking bland (as food tracking often feels for me), and I love the level of customization of goals and amount of pre-built recommendations available. While Carb Manager sounds like it’s designed for Keto diets, it actually works great for more traditional diet plans, as well (ie Zone, Body Building, etc). I use it for Low-Carb, High-Fat that was recommended by my doctor (not as carb restrictive as Keto), and it had that option pre-built, as well.

title: Great! Just one wish, to save shared recipes.
body: I’ve just converted to a Keto lifestyle, I tried a few apps and CarbManager has the best features while using the free version of the app. Thank You!!! I truly believe I can eat whatever my heart desires twisted to Keto, in that frame of mind I am always creating new recipes. In the last 4 days of having the app, I have created and added 4 of them. I love that it totals up all the nutritional values and when I add it to my daily food, let’s say as my dinner, those adjust to the serving size. I cook for a very large household and since a few of us are trying to stick to Keto friendly meals it’s nice to be able to share the recipes, however, they can’t save them so that they can benefit from the same nutritional information in their daily meal records. That means each app user has to create the recipe in their app, that’s quite frustrating. I’m hoping there is a way to update this, it maybe I am just saving wrong. I always give permission to publish when I create a new recipe, the little box is checked. I’m guessing it just takes a while to verify each one of those before they are published, which is understandable, but if we all had my invented dish for dinner then we would all like to have the benefit of just adding it once shared from the app, which is another feature I love! Thanks again for the great work!!!

title: Great App But Needs Tweaks
body: I found this app last week and really enjoy using it. It easily helps me keep track of my macros and lets me see what I’m eating and where I can improve. That being said, there are a couple issues that reduce the user-friendliness of this app. First, you cannot enter your own recipe and save it. This is a great feature of the Weight Watchers app that I was hoping this one had. I can import a recipe from online, but I haven’t seen where I can create my own recipe and save it. Instead, I have to individually list each item (in let’s say homemade salad dressing), and there is no option to copy multiple ingredients from one day to the next. So even though I drink the same Keto coffee or eat leftovers for lunch from dinner the night before, I have to painstakingly copy each ingredient one by one. If I could just simply copy each one, that would be great, but instead the app flips you to the current day after selecting the meal time to place the copied ingredient. Right now I’m trying to copy certain ingredients from Sunday’s dinner to Monday’s lunch, and each time I select an ingredient to copy, I get reverted back to today, then have to back arrow twice to Sunday, scroll down, and copy the next item. It’s time consuming and tedious and really the only thing I would say should be fixed to make the app more user-friendly and efficient.
response: Hi there, thanks so much for contacting us, and glad you are enjoying the app! To answer your questions: to add a custom recipe, please go to Foods > My Foods > Recipes. Tap the + Add New Recipe button to get started. To copy multiple food items from one day to the next, tap on the ... button next to either the food item or the meal header in the Daily Log and select Copy To... You can also copy an entire day's foods by finding the Copy To... button at the bottom of the Daily Log page. Premium users can also create a meal, which allows you to easily assemble foods together to log with one tap. Hope this helps!

title: Best NET CARB Nutrition App
body: (Update) Still the best app for tracking nutrition especially for calculating net carbs. However, the app is a little buggy at times which is usually easily remedied by closing the app and reopening; however, it’s inconvenient. That said, this app is still my favorite and is very well designed and targeted towards net carb calculation and tracking. The application interface and design is still the best out there.
response: Hi Mark, thanks so much for the feedback and for the great review! We're delighted that you're loving Carb Manager. (Another update - 1/28) We implemented some additional changes on the server that should make loading even faster now. You should start noticing the improvements today. Please let us know if there is anything else you'd like to see implemented or improved (including any bug fixes) by emailing us at support@wombatapps.com. We'll get on it asap. Thanks again for using Carb Manager!

title: Finally! An app that actually works.
body: Learning to eat clean is difficult, because boredom of the same foods can be a problem. The recipes help, but they should all be free. The per servings when creating food items is confusing at times. The preset food nutritional information when created by users, are sometimes misleading, there should be a way for the app to verify the carb, fat, protein and calorie intake.  I would also caution verifying the amount of calories burned during exercises that are entered by users. I also wish there was a way to convert per servings of a meal more accurate, although this app helped me lose 21 pounds in a month.  Note: I stopped all intake of soda, after this app calculated the nutritional value, and showed me the macros for soda.  I drank soda for 30 plus years. I would recommend a low carb, low fat, low calorie, high protein shopping list for beginners to print or download for shopping...it can be overwhelming getting started. Also, recommend incorporating shopping list with recipes, makes it easier to get started.  Lastly, incorporating nutritional information with the grocery list would also help beginners do their shopping.  Getting started was confusing, but out of all the apps, this one has helped me best.

title: Loving it!
body: I have tried multiple diets and multiple apps but this app is by far the easiest. It generates with nice visuals the percentages of everything you're eating and it's very user friendly. I started my modified Keto diet about 2 weeks ago and was dreading creating a meal plan and logging it but this app makes it so easy, I've already lost more weight than I anticipated.

title: Pleasantly surprised
body: I’ve had the two major calorie trackers for years which I found helpful but they never really aligned with my specific goals- just made me anxious about calorie counting and did not help shape a healthy relationship with food. I’m trying to get away from calorie counting and just stick to low carb as I just believe our calorie counting culture is unhealthy (especially for women) but I do think being mindful of nutrition is super important.

title: Easiest to use for LCHF
body: I’ve been using the app daily for more than 7 months now.  I’m down 58lbs, and I think carb manager has helped me stay on track.  It’s easy to use, and provides all the information I need. I have the premium so I can also track my micronutrients.  (Electrolytes!) The free version works as well, so there’s no need to purchase the premium version.

title: Needs fine-tuning
body: This app works really well overall for tracking your diet.  However, there are a few annoying things that would be pretty easy for the app developers to fix. 1) please include an option for GRAMS for every ingredient! Even if it’s a liquid!!...Weighing ingredients is preferred for many of us tracking our macros. 2) When you click to add an ingredient/food, it gives you a list of items you commonly use. This is nice, but if you can’t find the item on the list, and you start to type in the item’s name, the commonly used ingredients don’t show up! Please make it so that items you commonly use show up when you start to do a typing search. 3) There are some issues with some food items not having amount options, and the only option is to choose the number of servings, and it doesn’t show how much a serving is.  This is probably due to the user not entering in all of the packaging information when they enter the item.  The problem is that subsequent users do not have to way to modify the product Information to make it useable.  Those are the main annoying issues I’ve come across while using this otherwise great app.

title: Amazing app, needs more food entry options
body: I’ve had this app for years, and it keeps improving. I love how the app provides a prediction for when you will reach your weight goal with the calorie deficit that you set. I also love how you can set your own macro goals or diet goals (like keto, protein, etc). You can also track your sleep, water, and exercise, and choose whether your exercise automatically subtracts calories from your daily calorie goal or not. Also, very easy to use app with a great overall look and cute congrats animations. I think the only downside that I can think of, is that there needs to be more food entry options. When I did Keto, I didn’t have any problem entering in what I ate, but for foods that don’t fit into the keto focus, often you have to just enter ingredients… which is inconvenient and time-consuming. For example, if I were to try to enter a s’mores, I would have to put the three ingredients because there is no s’more entry. Or even something more custom, like a kale salad topped with grilled chicken, tomatoes, and ranch. It would be smart to have a base salad option for this for example, where you could customize it, like you do when you order at a Panera or McDonald’s kiosk. Just an idea :) Otherwise, I love this app.

title: Really helps you stay on track
body: I really think this is a great tool to help you stay focused and within your goals for the day with your eating.

title: Updating my negative review
body: New version took a couple weeks to get used to but I’m coming around on it. It was very buggy and frustrating at first and I hated it so much that i canceled my future premium renewal. I still prefer the previous version, but I can tell there have been improvements since the initial launch of the new update so if you hate it, give it a little time.
response: Hi utlindsay - We hear you, and we appreciate your feedback. Rest assured that we're working around the clock to fine tune the new version of the app. While we're not able to assist with subjective issues like the colors or font, we'd love the opportunity to help you get the scanner working and to show you how to input liquid as ml. Please reach out to our support team in the app via Settings → Help & Support, and we'll be happy to assist. Cheers!

title: Not registering intake?
body: I just entered my “breakfast“ on another popular app, and it told me that 1 teaspoon of braggs apple cider vinegar and 2 teaspoons of Metamucil sugar-free registers as 40 caliries and 10g carbs.  I enter the same two items on this app, and it registers 0 calories and 0 carbs of any kind, total or net or anything. What am I supposed to make of this?  Does this app realize I ate at least something, and that this something does have at least calories, or not?? Also very difficult to navigate this app, as just trying to select how many teaspoons of something results in having to fudge with selecting the actual number of teaspoons and then the teaspoon/tablespoon selection itself, but there’s always this weird looking half bent number on the wheels above where are you need to line up those selections just so, so it appears that after you make all your selections, there is always something above and below it, and I don’t think there should be anything above it, zero. It’s very confusing. Additionally, it took me 15 minutes to figure out what to do after I got those numbers lined up… Eventually I wound up tapping where there is a checkmark in the green bar and that seem to make the selections “take“ And register in the daily food consumption list. It really should say something like enter or add or something, because it took me so long to figure this out.  I’m not a fan of this interface.
response: Hello and thank you for contacting Carb Manager support. We're sorry to hear that you've encountered some issues logging meals with Carb Manager. We'd love the opportunity to inspect your issue in further detail. Please select "Need Help?" in-app and reference the username "Bonito apps" so that we can assist you further. Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Easy Breezy App
body: Carb manager has made it so easy to calculate my macros for keto meals and edit all through the day, even has the option to take some of the prepared recipes and change an ingredient that recalculates the macros for you. This app has so many good tasting and variety of recipes that makes meal planning so easy. As long as I have the keto staples, I’m able to change to another recipe at the last minute to something else that I’m craving without falling behind on meeting my daily macro goals. I’m so glad I subscribed to the premium membership. Best part I was offered a discounted cost and glad I accepted the opportunity given to me. It’s all worth it. I don’t think I can do without carb manager now. I’m addicted to this app. So easy to count macros and look up my next delicious meal to prepare right there at my fingertips on my cell phone. Where ever I am I have easy access to view, add, subtract macros and ensure I have what I need to prepare a new recipe in case I need to make a grocery run while I’m out. You’ve made my life and meal planning to reach my weight loss goal too easy. Thank you Carb manager and I Love this app!

title: Making goals Achievable
body: I am so excited about this app!!  First all it is so easy to use!  The scan feature allows me to quickly add foods using the barcode on the product; then it calculates based on portion size you choose so you know EXACTLY what you’re putting in your body!  There is also an incredibly extensive quick search that has EVERYTHING you could eat in it!  The goals feature allows you to set your daily goals, then helps you track how the goods you eat add up to your goal totals.  I started this diet plan one week ago; I’ve been measuring my ketones daily and achieved mild ketosis on day three, and full ketosis on day six!!  I keep to a 20 gm carb restriction, and 1500 calories.  I have to say I feel GREAT!  I didn’t get anywhere near my 1500 calories today, and I don’t feel hungry!!  I have great energy, I sleep great and wake up ready to tackle my day!  Toss us the best I’ve felt in YEARS!!  I’m 39, with two kids, and excited that THIS IS WORKING! Carb Manager is definitely the key to my successful first week, and will continue to be my best Keto coach!!  Thanks got such a great app!!

title: Best Food Tracker in the App Store
body: Finally an app that has an easy interface, accurate food lists and a database of everything I eat.  The Scanner, unlike other apps hasn't missed a single item I have tried which ensures everything I want to track is counted precisely.   Getting into a Keto Diet can be a little confusing to figure out the percentages of foods, but no more. With Carb Manager, you have a simple to read Pie chart or circle graph with your daily values just to the right.   If you eat similar foods everyday there are multiple ways for you to bring them over to the current day.  I use the copy to command all the time.  It works for single items or entire meals.   The free version does everything I need, but because it works so well, I am going to buy the premium service so I can integrate it with my exercise goals and take advantage of the devices, get recipe ideas, meal planners and shopping lists.  One last note. This app syncs with a web page so you can also use your computer to do the same stuff as your smart phone.  5 stars.   My health thanks you!!

title: Upgraded version of app has become unusable
body: Have used the app for years, spending hours over time adding custom foods, nutritional info, etc. Upgraded to the new app, and when prompted for a login, the screen said existing data would be transferred over to new app. It wasn’t. Original requests for help finally got a reply of “just start using the new version and we’ll see what we can do. New requests for help with still-not transferred data have not been answered. I started trying to re-add foods, and really appreciate the barcode scan feature, which should save heaps of time entering info. Except some of it doesn’t match at all what’s listed on the nutrition info panel on the package. Multiple efforts to update info let me edit values, but then doesn’t save them, so only records in the daily log the wrong info/values. Totally frustrating waste of time. New version is not at all intuitive as previous version was. Am giving up on this app, as I can no longer use it to accurately capture macro nutrient counts or edit incorrect info or regain any of the info or progress data  I had previously entered over 4+ years. It’s a great idea and served me very well for a few years, but new version needs some improvement for accuracy, usability, and support.

title: Perfect for getting started
body: I am trying the Keto diet and did not know where or how to get started with all the rules, seems everything has carbs in it...I downloaded the free app and it’s great! It helped me purge what I had in the house, took a bit of entering all the items in the app, but the effort was worth it. Not only did it tell me what was in the food, but more importantly to me, made me conscious of what I HAVE been eating and what goes in my body now is in the front of my mind. Especially that I’m not getting younger... I’ve used this app for just over a week now, and have already lost 5 lbs, have not touched a weight, walk, treadmill, any sort of cardio, and I feel great! (A little help from a friend, take a couple of shots of pickle juice each day the first week, sounds weird, and bathroom visits, but it works and is worth it!!!) I’m not at the point where I want to pay for the extra, but the basic free app is well worth it to be more conscious of what to eat and what not to eat. Recommend it if your not very ‘food savvy’ of what macros are in the food you eat.

title: Nice app but confusing
body: I was referred by a friend to use this app and I’ve been using it for a month now. Some of the foods are confusing; for example eggs = 1 carb. I’ve looked at all the eggs sold at my local chain supermarket and none of them have carbs. 🤨

title: Has potential but not quite there yet
body: This app seems old and clunky compared to myfitnesspal and lose it.  The interface feels really old. Also I’m visually impaired and there is no dark mode to make things easier to see. That needs to be implemented for free as not everyone can see tiny writing in lightly colored font. I hate that developers never test their stuff to see if it’s easily accessible for those with less than perfect vision.  As a developer you should always err on the side of making the background dark and the font larger to accommodate for everyone!  I shouldn’t have to ask to be able to see the app like everyone else. One thing I like is that Carb Manager has most foods when I scan a barcode. I use more than one app as I like to compare them all.  Please take some time to make this app look more modern and include more features like LOSEIT and Myfitnesspal. Carb manager has virtually no competition as no other apps really focus on the low carb/keto lifestyle and you would get more premium subscribers if you added more features and accessibility to the app. Not sure if premium is worth it  for me
response: Thanks so much for the constructive feedback!. While I can't give any specifics at this point, I think you'll really appreciate our next major app update :-) If you have any questions in the meantime, don't hesitate to reach out to our support team at support@carbmanager.com

title: Love the Carb Manager Keto Diet app
body: Love this app!!! I am able to manage my Carb intake. It allows one to track net carbs, total carbs, fiber, fat, protein and calories, by inputting to my daily log. Your Able  to create your favorite recipes, scan in your favorite Keto food. One of my favorite things on this app is the Keto Grade. This allows you to see if your choice of food is allowed on KetoDiet. Gives you a grade, for example, if you input something that is not Keto friendly, it will give you a grade F (avoid). For us newbies on Keto this is a great tool to have on an app. Also able to track water intake, as well as your Exercise, cardio, weights. Also tracks ones weight and body measurements. This app is everything you need to be successful On the KetoDiet. Great app for free. Now they do have Premium version. It cost, I would purchase the Premium, but, my budget does not allow it right now. The Premium gives you access to many recipes, meal planner, shopping list, you are able to connect with your fitness device. Connects to Fitbit, Garmin,  Apple Health, Apple Watch.

title: Don’t waste your money on these fake reviews!
body: (Update) sorry guys, the fact that it’s your busy season doesn’t excuse you from not replying for 5 days.  Apparently a small group of customers had a glitch in the update and couldn’t access premium. Update your chat to set proper expectations when people do need support!!  Despite my extreme frustration about this, it’s an awesome app that’s super easy to use. Highly recommend it, just don’t expect service to respond for days.

title: Carb Manager
body: I love carb manager, it is great and very easy to follow, it allows for a variety of low carb foods. This is the best thing going. And I love the recipes that are available. So far, I have made the Turkey Chili which was just wonder, I also made the Turkey Loaf, the chia pudding. If you are serious about losing weight, carb manager will get you there. I have lost 25 pounds since May of this year. You have to put some effort in and exercise which I consider now  a plus benefit. This time last year I had so much arthritic pain that I  could barely walk. I am walking now independently (no more cane), no more gout pain and no more arthritic pain. I attributed most of that arthritic pain to the high sugar intake (candy, cookies, doughnuts). My feet and ankles were always swollen due the high intake of salty snacks. My BP is down. My doctor has taken me off Lasix and several other pills. Now I am down to 1/2 tab of BP meds and 1 cholesterol tab. I feel great physically and emotionally. Now I look forward to preparing my meals and exercising daily.

title: Updated version is not as good or intuitive as the last.
body: We’ve been keto for 3/4 year. Been tracking the last few months to get back to deep ketosis for medical reasons. I like to know my macro breakdowns per meal (two meals a day) and before I could flip my phone sideways to see how much protein and fat at each meal and which foods had how much (learning so I don’t have to track forever.) with the new and improved app, I can’t do this from my phone and but have to use the computer which is inconvenient. It only shows calories and carbs. It’s also harder to do the recipes. It’s annoying to have to save a recipe you are trying to make, and then go back and find it to see how the macros pan out, then go back and change it and continue the process until it is how you want it. (Some recipes are too low or high in fat or carbs and a few substitutes need to be made.) A continuous tally available while making the recipe would be nice. It works ok for keeping track but definitely has weak spots for anyone who wants to use it on a continuous basis. I wonder if the developers tried using it for a day in their own lives before launching? 🤔

title: What did they do??
body: I’ve been using this app for a year or so. It was always good. Very flexible. I picked it up again recently, and thought they’d broken it, it was sooo different. But very quickly I came to love the changes. It’s intuitive, adds information quickly, has a few cool new features like muli-add, etc., it was improved.

title: No free recipes..but it looks nice.
body: They say they offer free recipes but they don't, they only give recipes for the premium. And if they DO have free recipes then there is no way to actually tell which recipes are for premium and which are for free unless you tap on them. Also, when you click on the “search for a recipe” button, they give you a bunch of premium recipes on the front page so you’ll be scrolling for hours tapping and trying to find one for free which you probably wont be able to do. They have a search option, but no filters to go through either for the picky eats who are on a budget and looking for a quick recipe that a two year old would eat.
response: Thanks for the feedback! The recipes do require a subscription, but the macros tracking components are all free, and you can create your own recipes for free.  We do have a recipe filter feature. Please go to Foods > Recipes & Meal Plans > Search Recipes and tap the down arrow button next to the search field to see the filtering options.

title: Love Carb Manager.....and, here’s why......
body: I do Intermittent Fasting and Low Carb, so I’m thrilled CM allows me to track both in one app.  Not only that.....I can track weight, macros, minerals, lab results, body measurements, BP, body fat, exercise and water intake.  The app also synchs with Fitbit and other devices.....Plus there are tasty keto recipes.😋

title: Hooray for Carb Manager!
body: I’m a 60-year-old male, recently diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes with high blood pressure and sleep apnea. I’ve been obese for more than 25 years. I’m now under the care of a weight loss doctor who mandated that I use the Carb Manager app. I was apprehensive about logging my meals and snacks at first, but I actually enjoy planning and tracking what I eat. And I’m losing weight. 2 years ago I weighed 300 pounds. I managed to lose about 30 pounds and lower my A1-c score from 6.4 to 5.9, but gained 10 pounds during the COVID-19 shutdown and my A1-C spiked to 6.5. Working with my new doctor and using Carb Manager, I’m confident I will stay on track and meet my weight loss goal, lower my blood pressure and mitigate my sleep apnea over time. I weighed 261 pounds today and have lost about 15 pounds in 6 weeks. I love this app and I look forward to recording my meals/foods/drinks for the first time in my life. My goal weight is 175 pounds but I will be happy with 190. I’m 5’11” tall with a large frame. Thanks Carb Manager!

title: Premium recipe?
body: I was previously using MyFitnessPal to track my food but it didn’t show carbs unless I subscribed to premium. So I found this app specifically for keto! How cool! I created an account and started to log my daily food and realize I can’t log my lunch because it’s “premium recipe”... I know EVERY stupid app makes you pay for features that slightly improve use or enjoyment. But making people subscribe simply to WRITE DOWN a food item is ridiculous. I know most that will read this comment will just say “it’s only 8 bucks a month just subscribe.” But honestly EVERY dollar counts to me right now and I can’t. I’m trying to better my life and lose a lot of weight to stay healthy for my husband and I to hopefully have a child soon. I can’t afford to sub. So I guess I’ll just pick some other food item that’s similar even though it’s asinine to even have to. This isn’t FarmVille or some game people spend money on for extra loot chests or whatever. It’s a life management app and I just want to watch my carbs in one place without being harassed to buy yet another monthly subscription to something.

title: Dishonest pricing
body: I had been using carb manager for a few months. I love it for tracking net carbs and finding out new recipes from other users. It would remind me daily about premium for $40 a year. I thought about it but figured I didn’t need it since I only was using it primarily for tracking net carbs. That was until I got a Fitbit. Which to sync it I needed to buy into the premium. I sucked it up to buy it. Which it a equivalent of 4 hours of my work day. Part of syncing you need to go into the site. Imagine my delight to find out just a matter of 10-30 second after purchasing it on the app and switching to online I was offered it for $30. Wait I just paid $40 for it.... so why offer the discount AFTER I paid for it? I figured I would reach out to costumer service. Joke! They won’t offer a refund of $10 due to inconvenience. They said they don’t offer the discount even if it was shown right after it was paid for.🙄. I am a manager in costumer service and let me tell you, that is not how you treat a costumer. I will be calling my bank to tell them to make sure the $40 gets cancelled. Along with forwarding this review to apple and Fitbit.

title: I’m finally really doing keto
body: I am thrilled with this app.  I have tried keto on my own and have never succeeded. I would cut out what I thought I was supposed to be cutting out and I would not feel any better and I would not lose any weight. I have been using Carb Manager for about two weeks now and I know I’ve already lost 10 pounds. I started out at 234 lbs. I think I’ve lost more but it’s not time for me to weigh yet. I have no complaints about this app. It took a little bit to learn all the different things about the app but I have been able to figure it all out without any help.    I finally understand the whole macro thing! This is what has been missing. I still had a mindset about fat.  I’m 55 years old so I’ve had a lot of years of hearing that fat is bad fat is bad.  I am doing great and I’m having plenty of food to eat and I’m never starving in fact I don’t even feel hungry I just get shaky.  Thank you so very much for this app. It is changing my life!

title: Very precise, easy to use!
body: I have tried a lot of different health apps. This is by are the best. I don’t usually care enough about something to leave a review, good or bad. But this app does everything I need it to. I have to be extremely careful with my carbs for blood sugar’s sake. It is so nice to be able to see my day at a glance, and note my trends over time. You can do this with almost any app, but the difference here is the EASE. It is so easy to use! I love being able to copy my meals to different days. It does all of the nice things my fitness pal does, I.e. save frequent meals and recipes, give you your macro breakdown, set goals, PLUS it has education, it has meal ideas, and you can log blood sugar and other similar things (like keto readings). Other fitness apps takes ages to log meals, are glitchy. And the layout of things is confusing or at least usually is to me. This is the most user friendly app I’ve come across. Of all the ones I’ve tried, this one is the best!

title: Only app I use
body: I’ve been using this app for 2 years now. It’s one of the few that I purchased a premium membership. It’s worth it and to get the most out of the app and your goals, I highly recommend purchasing vs the free usage where you are limited. The intuitiveness and features of what I can do has surpassed a lot of other apps I’ve tried to use. I can track what I need to track based on my individual goals (macros), track exercise (just recently connected to my Apple Watch, so hopeful of that), look up recipes with instructions, log food with an extensive database to choose from (have yet to find something not already in the database!), etc. This app has instructions on how to perform exercises you may not be familiar with, videos on how to prepare a recipe, etc. This app does it all and the developers took everything into account. Definitely recommend! This is also the first review I’ve done on an app...it’s just that good.

title: Clunky update
body: As a Type II diabetic I like using Carb Manager as it’s helped me focus on my carb intake. I liked it so much that I switched from using My Fitness Pal, and even paid for a premium subscription. Now, with this so-called update, I’m about to switch back to MFP, since CM has become so annoying to use. There many things that I don’t like about the update, but I’ll start with the main ones :1) slow and faulty load - every time I launch the app, it grinds away trying to open until I get the message to try again! As soon as I tap that message, it launches almost immediately. This is not an internet or WiFi problem, it’s solely a glitch in the app. 2) you must manually scroll back up to the top of the page, as there’s no function to just tap on the top margin to have it automatically jump to the top. Very annoying and time consuming. 3) having to do a fresh search for items I’ve logged in many times, again, slow, cumbersome and time consuming! That’s just a start.  Hope these issues get fixed soon, or I’m gone!

title: The updated version is not as good as the old one
body: I used this app for about half year and love the clear and simple user interface of it. After it has been updated last month, things changed.

title: Best Diet App
body: I used MFP last year but found it frustrating at times.  I told myself I would not upgrade to Premium on this app until I had used it for a few days in the free setting.  After just one evening of checking out if the entry would be fast, if the app was easy to navigate, and if the resulting information offered was meaningful and easily understood, I purchased Premium for one year.  I was that impressed!

title: Very good but to be awesome....
body: I love the app. It has helped me to stay on track on my Keto limits. The only thing that would make me absolutely love it would be to be able to see recommendations of what else I can eat on the remaining carbs, proteins or fat for the day. For example, I have 4 net carbs left and I want to see like a list of foods I can eat with 4 carbs or less or may be type in 4 g net carbs and I will be able to see a list of the foods with those carbs with the amounts.
response: Hi there, thanks for contacting us and for the feedback! We've added many of these features: please go to Foods > Advisor to see foods and recipes that meet your macros. To search recipes by ingredients or type, please go to Foods > Recipes & Meal Plans > Search Recipes and tap the little caret next to the search field to reveal the advanced search options. Hope this helps!

title: Needs some improvements to be great.
body: I’ll start by saying that I use this app regularly and I love it. I love the “keto grade”, the ever-growing database of branded/user contributions. It’s fairly easy to spend up and really helps me plan and stick with my keto diet.

title: Great app, but not perfect.
body: This is by far the best food tracking app I’ve ever used and the yearly subscription is worth every penny.  This app makes finding what you need practically effortless.  The data base is massive, plus if you are having trouble finding a listing, you can scan the product’s barcode—including many supplements! You can also add your own favorite recipes as well as finding new recipes in the database.

title: Great tool but no IF timer.
body: After reading some reviews between different apps I decided to go with CM but after signing up I was surprised to find out that this app doesn’t include intermittent fasting timer, goals, or historical tracking. It’s even advertised as easy IF tracking but this only includes time stamps of when the food was entered.  Many other free apps include this option.  It’s a huge omission considering that many keto people also do IF. After doing some more research I see that this function is coming in future updates but it seems it’s been coming for months so I’m not holding my breath. Secondly it would be nice if premium subscription included some kind of the Milne support or support phone number. If you are not doing IF than you don’t have much to loose investing $9 or $3 per month in yourself and your health. If you can pay for Netflix you can pay for this and support these guys. It would be nice if developers could give us some timeline on when this IF timer will actually become available.

title: Great for Keto
body: I’ve been using this app for almost a year now and I love it. If you can do the premium version, it’s well worth it. Makes meal planning and finding new keto-friendly foods and meals super easy. I find it easier to hold myself accountable if I have visuals and I love the circle graph on this platform. Makes it easy to keep yourself in check. I went for part of the year with the free version, which is awesome on its own, but I prefer the paid version. It helps me track  all of my body measurements and food all in one convenient place and it syncs with apple health. Even if you’re not doing keto, this is a great app. I’ve used so many food trackers in the past (my fitness pal, weight watchers, lose it, etc) and this by far my favorite!!! Before paying for the premium service again, I tried out all of those apps again and even their premium versions don’t offer what this app has. Definitely worth it!!!

title: Good app! Can customize goals!
body: This is a good app and one that I have used consistently for years. It takes some persistence but you can go into settings and manually change exactly how many grams of carbs, fats, and protein you want a day. Which is so nice because most of the time all apps are focused on only calories.
response: Hi, thanks for taking the time to leave an in-depth review! Our paywalls only pop up once a day or anytime a basic user tries to access a Premium-only Feature. We investigated the issue and recommend you use tools to clean adware because what you are describing is unexpected behavior. If you need additional assistance with this, please reach out to us at support@carbmanager.com and our Support Team will be happy to help!

title: Great app, but could use some enhancements
body: I have tried several keto apps and Carb Manager is the best one. However, there are a couple issues with it that can be very frustrating. First - the search function is fair at best. Sometimes it works and sometimes the items it brings up are not even close to what is being searched for. If I want to add an avocado to my meal sometimes I can type ‘avo’ and the search brings up avocado with no problem. Other times I can type the entire word and still not get a single hit on avocado. Second - it’s great that members can add recipes but there is no control over the content, so all the member recipes and foods sometimes get in the way. I would like to have the ability to filter them out. For example, there are many recipes with no ingredients at all. These things just clutter up the search even more. I pay for this app, and I plan to stick with it. Maybe future updates fix some minor irritations.

title: App does literally everything
body: As an absolute NEW COMER to anything diet related .. I found this app literally guiding my decisions. Before I shove anything (food) in my mouth - I punch said food in the app- and find out how many carbs/ fat/ protein etc. I lost 30 lbs - literally by doing this. Could not be simpler. Do a little research - Decide what macros you want to use- For is we went Keto- which is a percentage of net carbs/ protein / fat- pick your macros from drop down menu- enter your weight - Click enter and you’re off and running. Input what you eat- and this app does the math and tells how many Net Carbs remaining for the day-  Calories, protein , fat etc. stick to that and you will lose weight. It’s that simple. You can track your steps, exercise , and weight. Can’t think of a healthy yet delicious meal? It’s got that too. Try it out- If I can lose 30 lbs with no additional work out besides working - You can too.

title: Amazing Tracking App!!!
body: This is by far the BEST food tracking app I have ever used.  If you follow the Keto way of life like I do, this is awesome.  Over the years I’ve used MANY weight loss apps.  Some from BIG corporations with their own programs to ones that were just an app company.  This app is so well created, developed, user friendly, and robust that I have ever used.  You know when you use an app and you think’ “I wish it did...”? Well, every time I think that with this app...IT DOES IT!!! I actually found this app because of a recipe search I did which led me to buy it for the recipe.  Even the recipes are amazing!!! They are simple, perfect for Keto, and just “normal” foods that most of us I already.  This app really helped me to kick off my Keto journey!!! Thank you!!!

title: App is great but doesn’t sync well with Fitbit. Support doesn’t respond.
body: I bought paid for a year membership to have Fitbit sync my steps. It synced for a day but then stopped, so I had to keep turning it on and off in settings to be able to start syncing again. A couple days ago it stopped syncing at all and said I had to turn Fitbit on through the carb manager website via desktop. I thought this was finally a fix - I went ahead and synced from their website and now it doesn’t work at all.  I followed all the steps to sync my Fitbit to the carb manager app. my Fitbit website is perfectly synced with the Fitbit app but the CarbManager app or website doesn’t sync at all. Very frustrating... if they fix the syncing my rating goes back to 5 stars but it’s 3 for now as it’s not delivering as promised right now. Disappointed I paid for a feature that doesn’t work.
response: Hey there, so sorry for the problem with Fitbit. Please contact us again via the support center and we'll ensure that this is fixed for your as quickly as possible.

title: Great app
body: I found this app a few months back and it’s actually been super useful and I love it. I personally find it quite easy to use and it’s great that it saves and tracks all the food that I put in so I don’t have to keep scanning the same things over and over again that I eat on a daily basis. I will say I do struggle to load this app quite often. I know it’s not my phone because I don’t have this issue with any other app but for whatever reason maybe I can barely ever get it open unless I’m connected to Wi-Fi and even then it sometimes takes forever to load which means I sometimes have to hopefully remember to enter things later on in the day when it decides to open. I’d love to give it 5 stars but when I’m rushing and trying to put things in quite quickly before I leave the house or am out and about it can be annoying and inconvenient and completely defeats its purpose. It definitely needs a few updates and adjustments but I would still highly recommended.

title: Extremely inaccurate
body: It’s easy to fall in love with this app at first. It’s easier to give them a five star rating with the automatic pop up “rate me” only minutes after downloading and believing it to be “the app that gets me away from MyFitnessPal and the old calorie counting”. And how cool is it that it makes meal plans for you? Yup that was me. However, this app is highly inaccurate. I was fooled by the 4.5 star rating, but it only makes sense. The way it’s set up makes it challenging to accurately rate it. And try to find the button to rate them after the fact. Good luck! I finally found it, obviously (marked “show us love” under settings). I went on google and found exactly what I thought. A lot of people complain of the accuracy. Not only are the recipes extremely inaccurate , so are the items scanned. I did a test and out of 15 items scanned, only two were completely accurate. I did not have this problem with fitness pal. Such a bummer. This app could really be the new best thing, but you can’t lose trust in your customers.

title: Good- downgraded due to recent issues
body: “Lightening fast” it is not- when it decides it won’t connect through a wifi that has been working with it & many other apps all day. So I go to the app store and see it has an update- hmm, that downloads fine but I “couldn’t connect” all afternoon?? I truly hate when developers force upgrades to continue access. BUT no required update was mentioned in-app?? Also I did not realize I had to have a connection to enter or EVEN REVIEW my foods- super inconvenient!!! That meant I had to resort to writing everything down on paper all afternoon! I don’t mind limited access to the food db, but we should be able to access favorites and our previous logs without an internet connection.

title: This app changed my life
body: I use very few apps. I don’t write reviews. But since this app has helped me so much, I must give credit where credit is due. ‘Getting Started’ allowed me to set up daily goals within a ketogenic program. The Keto diet often feels confusing and counter-intuitive but this app guides you through it, every day. It has been fascinating to learn all the time, about the true carb content of various foods. The Find Food section is just incredible. It has actually been FUN, dieting and using this app. I’ve been using the app for about 6 weeks now, and it is absolutely responsible for allowing me to lose 15 pounds. I did not think it was possible - I’m over 60 and injured so exercise these past months has not been possible. Seriously, if you allow this app to guide you and you are committed, you WILL lose weight. I just can’t recommend it enough.

title: I LOVE IT BUT.....
body: This is a great app. I would never use it to calculate your macros as their calculations are always way off, but once you put in your custom macros it’s a fantastic app to track your food. Frankly I couldn’t do keto without this app!! Having said that I wish I could copy entire meals to multiple days at a time. Right now it’s very easy to copy an entire meal or an entire day to another day, but if you have the same meal (for example breakfast every day) it’s impossible to copy it to multiple days at a time. Secondly, I paid for premium and as soon as the first “month “ was over, it went back to regular. Trying to reach someone in customer service is impossible because it’s basically some sort of robot that responds. The response is the same regardless of what question you ask. While it was easy enough to get a refund from Apple before I re-purchased the premium, I hope it doesn’t keep happening.

title: Perfect App
body: I was hesitant about paying for the premium features but it went on sale and I went ahead and pulled the trigger, so glad I did. I was a long time My Fitness Pal user but then I started Keto and I was frustrated that it wouldn’t do Net Carbs, it just wasn’t in my opinion really the best app for Keto so I wanted another solution. Carb Manager is Taylor design for this diet and makes it so easy. I am so impressed with all the thought that has been put into this app. Every time I think I wish I could do something I find that the developers have incorporated it into the app. It is so user friendly to use, I love the interface. I absolutely love the meal planning features, such a time saver!!! Speaking of meal planning the recipe selection is off the chain. Bottom line if your doing Keto and you want a tool to make it easy for you to track and plan in my honest opinion you can do no better than Carb Manager!

title: Good stuff
body: Third day using the app. I’m a 38 year old male. I had no clue how many calories and carbs were in the “healthy” food I’d been eating. The app has helped me understand the various properties of the food I eat and through the factual information, has provided me with much more freedom than I’d been used to. Using the app, I’ve come to find out I had been maintaining a diet of roughly 3,200 calories. Now, I am set up with an 1,800 calorie per day diet and so far I feel great! Much less hungry and more fulfilled.

title: The best carb manager/ low carb app EVER
body: Hello,

title: The best app I’ve ever used!
body: I love this app. I started keto a few months ago and didn’t know how to keep track of everything I was eating and how much I was consuming but thanks to this app that is no longer a concern for me. It is very customizable and easy to use. It breaks down all your macronutrients so you can understand how much you are really consuming and what your putting into your body. It also allows for you to input your own recipes and then it breaks it down into carbs, fats, protein, sugar and calorie amount so you can better portion it all out. This app made keto possible for me. Without it I would be completely lost. I am considering going premium even though the free version is more than adequate. That’s how much I love this app! Download it and put it to use, let it help you reach your goals. A some job to the developers of this app, you’re changing lives!

title: Best for Keto
body: I downloaded a few apps when I started Keto to see what the best one would be. I had been using MFP for years but if you’re doing Keto this is a much better option so you can see your macros right in your home page. My only complaint is that the food database is not as complete as MFP, and I have encountered a few errors on some food entries. These are things that hopefully will improve with time. You just have to double check a few things to make sure your numbers don’t get thrown off. I would also like it if there was an easier way to add friends that you know have the app. And I’d like to be able to share recipes that I’ve entered so that friends who are eatting the meal I’ve made can easily add an entry without typing the whole recipe in themselves. But for a free version this really is the best app I’ve found for Keto.

title: Night Shifter Woes
body: Up until today I would’ve given this 5 stars. Now I have to drop down because for a few weeks I was able to start “Tomorrow”’s - or any day- food list. Now it wants me to pay for Premium to do what I’ve already been doing for a month. As a 7 pm- 7 am worker at a hospital this capability has been important in starting and keeping to a healthier lifestyle as sometimes I work 3 shifts in a row, have one day off, and work 3 more shifts. It allowed my sleep deprived self to just look at my meals and pack lunch/dinner accordingly. No longer an option. I feel that allowing me to do the lists and then taking that option away unless I pay for it - and I found no mention of “trialing” the planning- is a little underhanded. Up until this I loved this app and it’s ease of use, easy interpretations, and for the planning! As a night shifter (not everyone has day jobs!) I find yet again, that developers forget not everyone runs on a daytime schedule.
response: Hey there, thanks for the feedback. Adding foods for tomorrow and future days is now free again! If this works for you and you have a minute, would you consider updating your review? Thanks again for using Carb Manager!

title: Nice app, one flaw?
body: I really like the format of this app and it has really helped me to start making sense of macros while on Keto diet. Before this app, I had no idea what percent of my diet was fat or protein. There is just one flaw that I question, and maybe I have not found a setting that exists to fix it, or maybe it’s a premium feature. My carb count always shows way over my limit and it’s because the app is not deducting fiber from my carbs. I eat one Mission Carb Balance wrap per day because it gives me 15g of fiber and only 3 net carbs (the spinach variety), but the app recognizes this as a full 18g carb, so I am always in the red, over my limit of staying under 20g (net carb) per day. If not for this the app would be perfect, well done! I appreciate using it. Despite this I highly recommend this app, you just need to deduct your fiber from your total carbs yourself and ignore the red.

title: Love it but...I have one issue
body: Just started using this app yesterday and it’s incredibly easy to use. You literally can just jump right in and start logging after filling out a few things. My only issue is that yesterday, which was my first day using the app, it would not allow me to finish logging my dinner. I had one more item to add for the day. Every single time I tried to log my grilled vegetables, the app would prompt me to upgrade to premium. There was no way around it other than to not log the veggies. Today the app Is allowing me to log as I start a new day. No where in the information do I see a maximum amount of items that you are allowed to log before having to upgrade. While I do not mind paying for an app like this, I always like to try them for at least a month to make sure I really like it. Open to suggestions...

title: Lots of bugs and not user friendly
body: There’s a decent amount of good reviews for this app so I decided to pay for a year of premium despite there being no free trial days. That was a big mistake on my part. This app is not user friendly and takes quite a while to figure out how to properly navigate. The feature that allows you to create a meal plan constantly bugs out before I hit save. I started a meal plan on a day just to test it out and see how it works. Then I updated the meal plan and hit start again. It ended up adding to the previous meal plan instead of updating it. I tried looking for ways to cancel the previous plan or delete meals individually but couldn’t figure it out. The shopping list feature also has bugs. I had a snack listed for my meal plans but later deleted the snacks and hit save. It still gets listed on the shopping list so I went back to check my meal plan and it’s not even listed on there anymore. I don’t recommend paying for premium. I definitely won’t be using it anymore and am waiting to hear back about a refund.
response: Hi sasalala751 - Thanks for letting us know about the issues. Those are definitely not typical for the app, and we'd love the opportunity to provide personal assistance and get this sorted out for you. If you haven't already, please reach out to our friendly support team in the app via Settings → Help & Support, and be sure to include your app store username for fastest service. Typical response time is about 24 hours right now. All the best in the meantime!

title: Search Functionality Is Subpar
body: The net carb functionality, nutritional breakdowns, and calorie counting functions of this app are just what you’d expect. As advertised. But finding the items to place into your meals is annoyingly difficult. Every time you attempt to add an entry, it requires internet. Then after finding the item you wish to add through their giant database, you have to search for it likes it’s the first time every time. You can’t search recently used for frequently used items. You can’t sort using recent. When you enter the search function before typing, it brings up recent items. But you have to scroll through them all to find the one item you used weeks ago. Why isn’t there better search functionality? And after adding it once, why can’t we add that item again without the internet? If MyFitnessPall has a Net Carbs function, I would have kept using it instead of this. Carb Manager has a lot of improvements to make to improve my ratings. Securely a mediocre app.
response: Hello from Carb Manager support and thank you for your review. We thank you kindly for the excellent feedback. Our app does have the functionality built-in to "favorite" foods you eat often. Also, we would be happy to show you how to view recently searched for items in the food log area. Please select "Need Help?" in-app and reference the username "dmerc86" so we can be of further assistance. Looking forward to hearing from you soon!

title: amazing!
body: the design is pretty basic - a little plain, kinda reminds me of windows 95 haha but overall it does what I need it to and i find that I use it daily bc its not overly complicated. Only thing I would love is to add a fasting log AND to be able

title: Works
body: It helped me loose 50 lbs in a year.  Took a month off, working on my next fifty now.  It is critical that you log everything BEFORE you eat it!   I tried the free version for about three days then paid for a year, it was totally worth it for the recipes, and to have it pull in data from my second Fitbit.    My lessons:   I do much better when I log water, don’t ignore that.   Short morning walk make a huge difference.  I drink an Ultima every day, use more salt, and added a cheap multivitamin, C, and D for days I don’t get good balance.  I know I would’ve gotten better results if I do exercise more but I’m just lazy. I have a cheat day once a month where I eat everything I want and a cheat meal once a week where I don’t get too crazy.  I did it with my wife and we joined a couple keto groups on Facebook for more crazy recipes. Good luck!

title: Love the updated up but room for improvement
body: Love the new look and animations. A huge improvement. I tried using MyFitnessPal for a while, but find Carb Manager just works for me better so I'm back and happy about it. Two pet peeves though are that so many people forget to include the sugar alcohols so net carbs for so many foods are incorrect. That's very frustrating. Something that should have 0 net carbs shows having 8 and that can throw off my entire day. How long does it take for products to get adjusted on the app? On the old app users could select an adjusted entry with the corrected nutritional values but I see that option is now gone sadly. Also two things I love on MyFitnessPal which I'd love to see adopted here would be the ability to swipe and add a meal from the food diary the day before. As well, I'd love a "copy from" the day before, instead of "copy to". That'd be much more convenient.

title: New version is dreadful
body: This app used to be so easy to use, but now...not so much.  I wanted to give it some time before writing this review, to give myself a chance to get used to it, just in case I was only resistant to the changes solely because they were new, but not necessarily bad. Nope. They’re bad. I’m forced to re-enter my custom meals as recipes so that the various elements will show, rather than just the macro totals.  All of my favorite foods have randomly changed their quantities, so when I enter foods into my log I’m now forced to reestablish the quantities I always use (example: I always use grams as my measurement, but now the app seems to have everything set to 1/4 cup).  I’m in this app all day long, and am very dependent on it. I’m stuck trying to make this work because I’m a premium member and don’t want to waste my investment. But if you’re new to food tracking, you might want to look at MyFitnessPal. I chose CarbManager because it seemed less complicated to me, but that is definitely no longer the case.

title: No subscription required
body: This is the best app I have found to track my keto macros that does not require a monthly subscription for basic use. I may subscribe in the future for a few months because the recipes look really good, but being new to this keto thing, the basic service is all I need.

title: Great app for tracking, terrible for searching their own recipes.
body: My wife and I got this app and use it together for ALL of our meals. It works great IF you are NOT sharing someone else’s meal plan. She loaded a whole weeks worth of recipes based off of CarbManagers meal plans and it is frustrating, if not down right impossible, for me to find the same recipes that she is able to enter. I’ve even used the web search with their recipe title and still no results. Ham and extra sharp white cheddar omelette should be pretty easy to find, or so you’d think. So......I get to search and search and search and search until MAYBE the app will recognize what recipes it allows her to make for us. Ugh!!! Being able to “share” recipes with friends on the app with ALL nutritional value and fixing the search for their own recipes would make me give this 5 stars, but the time I waste searching for a meal they design is a waste, hence the 3 stars.
response: Hey there, thanks for the feedback! If you go to Community > Friends, you can add your wife as a friend and then will be able to share foods, recipes, meals, and meal plans with her. Please contact us if you need any help with this via the support center. Thanks again for using Carb Manager.

title: Excellent app!
body: Just started using this app 2 weeks ago. Been tracking my Keto diet and this thing does all the basic things you need. Food logs, macro logs, exercise tracker! So far my only complaint is some of the foods listed are not accurate so then there are multiple people imputing the same item over and over. A database needs to be collected and set.

title: Fantastic, helpful app!
body: Everyone I know who has been uber-successful in losing weight writes down their food intake each day. That just wasn’t me. But this app changed everything for me. It makes it so easy to log exactly what you ate in the exact portion and gives you the exact nutritional count with graphs so can visually see everything in multiple ways. I can’t say enough about Carb Manager. I look forward to laying in bed each night and logging everything because it does all the difficult calculating for me. But it doesn’t stop there. Add your exercises, water, ketones, blood sugar, weight, on and on. I knew within just a few days using it that this was going to help my carb and weight journey so I paid for the upgrade. Well worth it. I only write reviews when something is very bad or very good. This app is beyond very good.

title: Really helps control the carbs!
body: I was struggling with weight loss even though my husband had provided me with a one month Keto diet plan designed to specifically fit me.  I was following the directions for the meal plan just as it was provided to me and I was losing very slowly bouncing up and down, a pound down then up, a little here, a little there.  My son, who had been on the Keto Diet for over a year told me about the Carb Manager program he had loaded on his his phone and how much it had helped him.  So, I downloaded Carb Manager and I could actually see what I was eating on the diet plan my husband had ordered for me.  I began to make adjustments, cutting out things here and there, like onions, I never knew they had so many carbs.  I just wanted to let you know how much I appreciate this program and how much it has been helping me.  Thank you.

title: Kick off after months of data inputting
body: I really thought this was going to work, so I trusted it with my data & my recipes. I started an account, but chose not to go with the premium account.
response: Hello from Carb Manager support and thank you for your review. We're sorry to hear that you've experienced a loss of data. We encourage users to create accounts, but even without an account, we can usually restore data if you are accidentally logged out. The only exceptions to this are if the account is manually deleted via Settings or if the app itself is deleted. Thanks again for contacting us, and please let us know if there is any other way we can be of assistance.

title: Nice design refresh but...
body: The actual tracking of carbs/macros is now more complicated and less accurate.  The old version - ugly as it was -  made it super easy to see my total macros consumed, goals, exercise/activity (for smart macros function) and adjusted net values all in one place at the bottom of the daily log.  Now you’re making me swipe through multiple charts to find this info. And not only that, the math is wrong! For example, when I add a food entry to a meal, the app will list the net carbs for that serving and let me know that if I add the item I’ll have maybe 2 net carbs left to “spend” that day. But then when I go to the Home Screen, it gives me a different number, often much higher. And by “home screen” I’m talking about the daily log where I now have to scroll through multiple chart views to figure out what my gross and net totals are for calories and macros.  What the...?!  I think you’ve prioritized form over function with this new update.  I’ve lost confidence in this tool now.

title: This app is a mess!
body: This app is incredibly frustrating to use unless you are prepared to put in ALL your own nutrition facts. There are so many people putting in nutrition facts for the SAME item and, most often, all of them are wrong. If you dig hard enough you might find one correct out of the dozens posted. Learn to read nutrition facts before sharing your entries! And read serving size! Some of the incorrect facts simply come down to people miss reading, or not reading at all, the serving size.
response: Hi & thanks! We work hard on the accuracy of our Food DB. It's true some branded/processed foods have been input by users, so if there are inaccuracies, you can always Report a Food Error or make Quick Edits to them. Just reach out in-app, & we can help share how as well as how to identify our NCCDB verified foods to make it easier for logging!

title: New version has glitches
body: I do like this app but they did a big change and now there are lots of glitches. Just to name a couple. When you scan a barcode it acts like it’s not there. It acts like it scans but nothing appears. It was a common food do I tried again. That time it appeared. Next day. Same thing. You have to scan twice.  Second the old version when you looked up a food you had used before it would remember how much you used so it was easy to type in heavy whipping cream and 1 tsp would be there. Now it reverts to the top measurement. So entering food takes longer. Plus certain measurements on certain foods are gone. So heavy whipping cream no longer has teaspoon. Other foods are missing measurements I used a lot like grams. I’m disappointed. If My Fitness Pal would make it easier for us keto people I would go back to them.

title: What a mess
body: Where to start... the majority of the nutritional information is incorrect. When you scan a barcode 9 times out of 10 you’ll either have to edit all of the nutritional information or add it in yourself.
response: Hi there, we truly appreciate your constructive feedback. Many of the issues you mentioned are either fixed or in the process of being resolved by our Development Team. Please reach out to us within the app or at support@carbmanager.com with the issues you are still experiencing and our Support Team will respond to you asap.

title: Pricey? Worth it.
body: If you’re serious about your health and/or doing keto, this app is essential. Easiest way to track your target (SMART) goals for weight loss. I’ve been able to see and adjust my calories, net carbs, protein, and fats and find the “sweet spot” that works best for me to keep me in ketosis. Absolutely worth it. If you’re on the fence, download the free version and play with it.

title: Best app ever for managing your diet!
body: I gotta say I’ve looked at many apps and this is the easiest, most user friendly app I have ever used. I began with their Recipe Builder app and didn’t think you could improve on anything until their customer service told me about their newest app...and OMG, I’m in love with this app. I don’t want to spend a lot of time trying to figure out how to record different serving sizes. This app has all that taken care of so it takes the guesswork out of it. I haven’t run into to any bugs with. Runs perfectly for me. The only two things I need are to be able to see the remaining calories for the day on the app badge and I’d like to be able to import my recipes from the old app. Even so, I can live without that since this app is so darn easy and has so much to offer.

title: not sure about upgrading
body: I’ve really been enjoying the free app. I’ve been using it and another app called Eat This Much. The reason I haven’t upgraded is because the one thing I like about the ETM app is that it will suggest foods at the end of the day based on my macro targets, calories and how many carbs I have left for the day. So if I have 4 carbs available and my carb intake has been at 3% it will make suggestions or recipes and foods that I can choose to hit my targets. I don’t see any reviews commenting about this feature just the lack of it. Is this something the app will have at some point?

title: I love Carb Manager
body: I started using Carb Manager the day after Labor Day. My weight was 229 and I didn’t feel good. I started the Keto diet and needed a way to track my macros. It is now November 20th and I weigh below 200 pounds for the first time since 2013. Carb Manager is easy to use but you absolutely need to be honest and put everything in that you eat or you will fail. The circle helps you see your progress. It shows all of your recent foods so they are easy to add when you eat them again. I would not have done this without this app. It has made it so much easier. I am a Keto lifestyle person now and plan to keep using the app. If I don’t, I will start eating hidden carbs. That sets you up for failure. It takes just a few seconds to enter what you eat, or plan to eat and that is important. I love Carb Manager.

title: Best dieting app ever
body: I hate dieting. This is the first time I’ve ever done it in my life. But I like the keto diet: it’s scientifically sound and helps me cut out just the bad stuff. This app is the perfect companion. It’s extremely well-designed and targeted for low-carb and keto diets, makes it easy for me to track what I’m eating, and never makes me feel bad FOR eating! I was really nervous when I searched for a diet app because I didn’t want to make dieting any worse for me, but this app is helping and not hurting. Especially with keeping track of the “invisible” carbs that fall through the cracks. The developer clearly put a lot of time and effort into this app. Little things like the built-in water counter - something it’s very important to make sure you have enough of in the early stages - really make it obvious. Bravo and thank you.

title: Carb counter that counts all Macros
body: I wanted to count carbs for weight loss, but I needed the reminder to eat protein since that is the key to me keeping my carbs down. So seeing the protein easily in addition to the carbs is just what I needed in a diet app.

title: I love this app
body: First and foremost, this app does have a pay option. You can upgrade to get access to more things, like premium recipes. I’m poor and cheap 😂 so I use the free option in this app and I really like it a lot. The options that I have are good enough for me. I love that I can set my specific diet plan such as “Keto”, “low fat”, “build muscle”, and this app will help guide me into that path. I had NO IDEA I was eating so many carbs! My mind is blown but I’m excited to continue on my weight loss journey. Oh, and one more AMAZING aspect of the free option, you can simply scan the barcode of a package of food, instead of typing in the brand name and style and amount. It’s super handy. Please, please, please keep the free portion free. It’s a God send for people like me who are practically breaking the bank purchasing healthy foods.

title: Easy to use and effective!
body: This is, by far, the easiest and most effective carb/calorie/fitness app I’ve ever used (and I’ve tried a lot of them). I think if I had something fancy like an Apple Watch or Fitbit I could better track my exercise by syncing up with this app, but the options in the app will suffice for now.

title: New Update Ruined a Perfect App
body: I have been a Carb Manager subscriber for years. It’s the perfect way to track my carb/calorie intake each time I need to lose a little weight. Or it was.. this new update has completely ruined the app (mid-diet, btw). I lost almost all my saved recipes. Nutrition data is inaccurate ~50% of the time now, particularly when you choose to weigh things out in ounces (which I do for everything). I have to stop what I’m doing to report each case of inaccurate data, which is impossible when I’m in the middle of cooking and trying to rebuild a recipe I used to have saved. Plus, the interface is oversized. One logged day used to fit almost all one one screen (without scrolling), but now theres so much extra data built in, I have to scroll three times as far. It was clearly not redesigned with a regular size iPhone screen in mind. It really is a shame, I will be cancelling my subscription and will be on the search for another app that is closer to the original version of this one.

title: I’m dependent on it now
body: Honestly, I don’t even restrict carbs anymore, but I use this app to track my calories and macros. After using it for over a year, it has all my best recipes saved and it would be too much trouble to move it all up another app. The interface is great, I only wish it was possible to set it to track protein goals rather than carb goals.

title: Great AP and almost forgot it was an AP
body: Reason why, this is a community. Somehow “they” (AP makers plus community doing this) have taken the whole bz of weight loss into something almost scientific.  Why? Because, with the keto strategy, you can get some keto sticks and check ur urine (or blood) and see if ur intake is what ur intending it to be. I think most people who remain in a ketotic state for at least a week or two will drop pounds with this and often quickly so. I’m working on just how to best use this as are many others on the AP or site. Good luck with all, but if you’re looking for is something “new” and practical, not to mention with community of some real smart people, this is surely something to try.
