I’d also recommended the premium upgrade - for just$39/year MOST worthwhile !

title: First-time user
body: I've only used this app for about three weeks, so I'm really a newbie. Decided to try keto because of the type of Ca I have and, also, to support my wife's weight loss. One thing I've noticed is that I really eat too much! Carb Manager has been instrumental in convincing me of that fact. As well, another thing I've noticed is that, after populating MyFoods (Favorites) with several "generic" foodstuffs and with several "scanned" products, the list gets pretty messy. Whereas, Romaine (Cos) Lettuce is under the R's (where I would expect to look for it), things like, "Deli Boar's Head Ovengold Turkey Breast by Fresh Direct" are under the B's, and I have to look all over for it. Perhaps, on a future up-date, we could expect that scanned product to read, "Turkey Breast, Boar's Head Ovengold, by Fresh Direct". All-in-all, this app does what it sets out to do--in Spades; I am in awe!

title: HOLDS YOU ACCOUNTABLE
body: I love this App.  I never read nutritional values as I didn’t have the time to count it all up and actually journal.  This App does it all for you the only thing you have to make sure is to journal and it makes you decide if it’s worth it to you to eat.  I’ve lost weight and still enjoy going out to eat.  I figure out by putting what I’m going to eat from whatever restaurant in my journal first.  All the calculations are done for you with this App so if it’s over your allowed intake you start changing things around.  I start by removing the carbs like bread and croutons so I can still enjoy my food.  I only bought the month membership after trying the free to see how much I would use it.  I will be purchasing the year subscription as soon as my month is up.

title: Really good, needs a few tweaks
body: Overall the app is really good and has most foods already in it. For the ones it doesn’t, it is really easy to add! However, when adding food to a previous date the app will change the date back to current. Even with no other change of screen. Add food to breakfast two days ago, still in the add screen and try to add something to lunch the same day, but all of a sudden you are back on todays date. Have to exit out, change the date, and search again. Also, I understand why it is an internet supported app (have to have internet to work), but they really need to add an offline version where you can still add foods but not search their database. I’m active duty USN and when the ship is out to sea, I cannot use the app. I CAN log in and use it on the computer, however, the internet is not always available on a warship. If they can fix those two issues this would be an easy 5 star app!

title: Perfect for Keto
body: This app has been extremely helpful in tracking my daily carb intake.

title: Tracking your food & drink intake to be successful!
body: I love this app!  I have safely lost 11 pounds in two months at 67 years old.  It is so easy especially if you track your glucose and ketones.  This app has the ability to enter those numbers and get your true Ketone status called the GKI number.   The best part of being on the Keto diet for me is I am NOT hungry!  That makes it extremely easy to follow!  I don’t have my evil cravings tempting me on this eating plan.  There are many ways to do Keto wrong. This app helps to guide you especially if you enter your foods, measurements (weight, glucose and ketones) to do this correctly.  Read all the information you can for knowledge is power.  This app has all the tools to help you be successful. All you need to do is make it happen for yourself!

title: By Far the most helpful Keto Ap
body: I have been practicing Keto for 6 months now and just began with this ap a couple of weeks ago. It has made everything so clear and easy to see exactly where I am at every day. I am the type of person that enjoys facts and not a person that enjoys tedious tasks so being able to scan my main foods in just once and then add them to my personal food list to click on each day as I eat has made it as factual and easy as possible. I would recommend this for non-Keto people too, it really helps you stay in touch with what your consuming no matter what results you are looking for. I upgraded to the premium because I want to see my nutrition stats as that is what matters most to me but the recipes will be a great addition too.

title: Update ruined a great app
body: I used this app religiously for months to track my macros and calories, until the new update. Now, the ability to copy certain parts of a meal take way longer than than it should because you have to copy them one at a time then go back to whatever date you’re copying from, and repeat, or copy the entire meal then weed out the parts you don’t want to copy.

title: I love this app!
body: I am using the free version of this app and have only been doing so for about 7-10 days, but this app tracks everything I need it to. I like how it tracks how many carbs and how much fat I’m eating as well as my weight loss and measurement goals. I’ve tried other weight loss plans and after spending an insane amount of money and being hungry all the time and not losing any weight I am confident this one will work. I work nights which is especially challenging for weight loss and I tend to just mindlessly eat constantly. Every time I head to the refrigerator to put something in my mouth I say my new mantra, “if you’re not hungry, don’t eat” and it seems to be working. I know that sounds stupid. Instead I grab some seltzer or a stick of gum. Thank you.

title: The only Keto app I will ever use!!
body: I’ve tried a few apps but none as complete and detailed as this. I learned about the new HCG Keto Protocol 3.0. So, I decided to finally purchase the premium version which allows me to readjust my macros for carb macros cycling and intermittent fasting. It’s the only calculator that accommodates this diet protocol. It would be nice if the developers added a way to record the HCG protocol phases. Phase 1 is the Loading Phase and can be recorded in the “ease into the diet”. But it currently doesn’t work. Also, if there’s a way to have multiple goals to set up for each phase, that would be great. Finally,  there should be a “ Medications” section where we could add relevant prescription meds such as HCG or appetite suppressants.

title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE THIS APP
body: Lost ~350 pounds years ago on a starvation keto, one meal a day diet.  Do not recommend!  Kept it off for thirty plus yrs until close to ten pounds came a-creepin.  I planned to go low Carb again, and discovered KETO is now Big Business!  This app is used by many in a KETO group I joined, and I figured ‘why not’?  I am very, very pleased, and will be getting the upgrade for Christmas (my family promised).

title: Good
body: I liked it, but searching for exercises is not easy. The search is slow, and you have to scroll through a million results to find what  you want. You basically have to search letter for letter what you want, or it won’t give you any results. And your only option for cardio is searching. It doesn’t give you a list to choose from like it does strength training. And you can only put in minutes - not hours. It’s very disorganized and inconsistent.

title: Seriously worth every penny !!!!!
body: A sweet friend of mine has been after me to try the Keto diet again and I have been using another Keto app that is super expensive and renews every six months.  So when I told her about it, she said try this one.  It’s a yearly fee and much less expensive than the other one I was using.  I can do so much with this app and I use it every single day to track all my foods, exercise etc on the Keto diet.  I can plan my meals days in advance which helps with staying healthy.  I’m still learning all of the bells and whistles but this app offers a ton of flexibility and options for tracking everything !!!!  This is worth every single penny and you’ll be glad you spent the money.  This has been a HUGE help in my healthy weight loss journey !!!!

title: Update after latest update
body: Love that you brought back the graphs even renewed my premium subscription. However, now after this recent update after entering my food eaten the graph is blank nothing shows up.  It did come back hours later but it still will be blank every time I enter my food for longer than I would like.  The graphs are so helpful. Please look into this problem and you will receive 5 stars Thanks.

title: Incredibly awesome diet app!!
body: Although it takes a few days to master this app, it is the most comprehensive carb counting diet app I’ve seen!  If you don’t have complete nutritional information to help you count your daily carb intake, you can scan the product barcode and it will tell you what the nutritional information is.  It has an extensive database of homemade and name brand foods and you can enter recipes and the app will provide the nutritional information.  All your inputted information can be saved to the database and the app administrators will double check the nutritional information and fill in the other macronutrients for you.  I’ve lost 13 pounds on the low carb diet in one month and this app has made it possible for me to make good choices.

title: Helpful but needs a few updates
body: Started using this app when I started keto a month ago. What I've found so far is that the app is very easy to use. Can easily add foods and create your own recipes. The issues I've found is that it freezes up a lot (I often have to shut off my Wi-Fi to get it to kick in) and the scanner occasionally just won't work. The most important change that needs to me made is in the groups. I posted a comment in a group but then later had to scroll through all the other comments to find mine again and see if anyone replied. No notices if someone responds to your comment and no easy way to locate your comment to read the responses of you get them. This makes it next to impossible to really utilize the groups for assistance. Please fix that!!

title: Not impressed
body: I purchased the full version, I’m not impressed. The ad stated that the meal plans were customizable but they are NOT. You don’t have the ability to not have foods that you don’t like on them. They’re just pre-made plans, put together by who knows who that you can tailor to your specific range. The rest of the features are useable on the free plan. Wish I could get a refund! Don’t waste your money, the full version doesn’t live up to what the ads say are available. You can find free meal plans online that you CAN customize.
response: Hello, and thanks for sharing your experience. It is possible to generate customized meal plans. Please reach out to customer service at Settings-“Need Help?” and they can walk you through the steps.

title: So close, but man your graphs make no sense
body: I love this app- mostly. Use it multiple times per day to track my food, set macros, look up food (the data’s not 100%, but that’s not unusual for something including crowdsourced data - it’s much more useful than not.)
response: Thanks for sharing your experience, and we're happy to hear you're finding our core app useful! We do offer some accessory features for users who want a deeper analysis of their journey, but those are always optional to use. If you have questions about how to obtain use or understanding from them, we'd be happy to help. Just reach out in-app and we can connect! Thanks!

title: Frustrated
body: I purchased the premium app because I was committed to making this work. My second day in using this app and I cannot select the same items as I had selected the day before. It appears I am selecting the same item but then something completely different shows up in my log. I’ve tried every which way to reset my phone and the app thinking there must just be some sort of glitch but nothing seems to work. these are some of the core foods I’m eating right now so at this point I can’t track anything and I’ve wasted $40 on an app that does not work.
response: Thanks so much for the constructive feedback!. While I can't give any specifics at this point, I think you'll really appreciate our next major app update :-) If you have any questions in the meantime, don't hesitate to reach out to our support team at support@carbmanager.com

title: Shopping list not organized
body: I bought the premium app. The meals and recipes are nice. I like a lot about this app but the one thing that I don’t like is the shopping list feature.  The list is not organized at all and you can’t remove items if you don’t need to buy it.  You can only cross it out.  The items are listed alphabetically, which does not make any sense. Items should be group by category, like produce, frozen foods, dairy... not avocados at the top and zucchini at the bottom of the list. And if you add two recipes that call for three eggs for one and six eggs for another... the shopping list does not combine the amount of eggs you need.  It lists them separately.  Sometimes the same item is on the list more than twice and they are not listed next to each other.   I think the free version is nice but the upgraded price is not worth it.
response: Hello from Carb Manager support and thank you for your review. We're excited to hear that you're enjoying the recipes and Premium features. We're taking into consideration all of your suggestions for improving the shopping list features. If you'd like to discuss more any suggestions you have, by all means, please contact us! You can select "Need Help?" in-app and reference the username "KrisElm18" and we'll be happy to assist you further. Thank you!

title: Great App
body: As a newbie, this app really helped in figuring out what a daily intake should look like for me. I love the resources and connections. And as nerdy as it is, I LOVE the visual representation of intake. As with most apps of this nature, I wish there was a setting to determine your day. Meaning, I work night shift, so my 24 hour day spans 2 actual days, because I'm waking up and starting my day at 3pm and ending it around 9am. Any goals for "the day" are technically not met due to a conventional time frame being applied to an unconventional schedule. It's a small and kind of insignificant inconvenience. But it's important to night shifters.

title: Great app! Just a few minor suggestions
body: We recently moved to the Keto Diet and decided to try Carb Manager. We chose the premium subscription, so all my comments are based on the feature set.

title: Love it, could use a few upgrades
body: Love the app. I paid for premium.

title: Very impressed with this app
body: I’ve used a few food tracking apps over the years, this is the best one. It makes it easy to track, to find foods, to create custom foods, to submit recipes, etc. I do have the Premium version and feel it’s well worth it.

title: Best app - One minor complaint
body: The narrow bar codes never scan and it seems like more and more companies are using them making it difficult to log food sometimes.

title: Very helpful tool to a healthier you!
body: This app has been extremely helpful in my journey to a healthier life. I used it for quite a while without purchasing the membership and it allows you to log all your food and exercise. The membership is awesome if you are just starting out. You can enter food sensitivities or foods that you want to avoid if you don’t care for them. It will literally generate a week long meal planner and give you a grocery list!! Or you can browse the recipes and add them to your favorites to try now or later. It’s an awesome app overall and you can even get involved in the carb manager community for support or link up with friends or family members to help support one another. I highly recommend this app!

title: The best tracking program!
body: I absolutely adore this program.  It is worth every penny for the subscription which is very minimal compared to other diet tracking programs out there.

title: Great freebie tracker!
body: Great app! You don’t have to pay for the premium account to get great use of this app. I was creating my own spreadsheet to count macros in different foods before I found this database and I’m pleased to save my time. The pie chart display makes it extremely easy to see if I’m short on any of my macros. You can save your own recipes to block in vs listing out individual ingredients over and over and over. Some common keto recipes (Egg Roll In a Bowl) are public access. New recipes are accessible for an additional monthly cost, but feels like an unnecessary luxury. Great app! Would love it if they’d go the distance of listing ingredients in different brands to help with planning the best meals. Developers— I might be willing to upgrade for that feature!

title: Clunky Meal Planning
body: Most my problems have to do with meal planning. App keeps crashing/recovering but losing progress when trying to build a custom meal plan. No easy way to swap individual meals or snacks if I hate particular ingredient in a pre existing meal plan. Cannot easily or at all look up a meal plan I generated for a future week, can only generate grocery list. You can only filter on fast and easy and not just easy. Sometimes easy things to bake are the best. Filters need a mega overhaul as free apps and websites help you find recipes on difficulty/involvement much better. No consolidation of ingredient choices.

title: Great app but wishing for one feature
body: The app allows me to track my macros in such an east and spectacular way. I also love using it to plan my meals. And the ability to make a “shopping list” is fantastic (although sometimes the quantities get messed up when you set it to get for the full recipe when you’ve planned to eat the meal multiple times).

title: Best App Ever!!!
body: I am a journalist who struggles with my weight.  Last year my nutritionist got me in the mindset of counting carbs but I needed help!  Every app I’ve researched and/or discovered were disappointing most because of ads and in-app purchases.  Then on Sunday, April 29th, I knew I had to find something because my eating was spiraling out of control and with every pound gain was a step towards death.  I found Carb Manager!! Finally an app that meet my needs.  I enjoy that I can get everything I need from carb and calorie counting to scanning foods as well as a food search to include a database.  Yes one can upgrade to premium but if you’re looking for an app that does the basics all for you Carb Manager is your tool on the journey to a healthier lifestyle.  Thanks for reading.. 😀

title: This App Keeps me on Track
body: I have tried everything kind of weight loss plan for the last 20 + years. My father in law suggested keto and I knew it meant some hard core dedication but it had to be done. At first I looked for a book to push and motivate me but then I realized I don’t want to carry a book around with me everyday so I started looking for an app for the phone since my phone is always with me. Carb Manager has saved my life. Down almost 40 lbs in 6 weeks cause I always got the app, the database, and the scanner which really helps. I couldn’t do what I am doing or stay track with my goals without this app. Don’t waste your money on a book or diet food. Eat real food and get healthy! I Highly recommend to get Carb Manager! A life saver!

title: This app is essential for keto
body: I have been using this app religiously (macro tracking, not weight tracking—i haven’t stepped on a scale) since I started the keto plan. It has been instrumental in my loss of several inches off my waist only seven weeks ago. I have maintained constant ketosis since, rarely having my carbs exceed 21 g per day (and never over 30) since I started. Doing this without an easy tracking method would’ve been impossible. I had nearly given up on weight loss, and I’ve never had any diet or weight loss program achieve such dramatic results do quickly. I now am confidently looking down the road to reaching my lifelong goal of fitness and “average” weight at the age of 53. This app is the best app I’ve ever downloaded, hands down!

title: YES 🥰❤️🎉
body: I was really worried when I started keto. Eggs, bacon, cheese, and LOTS of butter. Dr. Nick suggested getting this app in one of his beginning keto videos. I was skeptical, but downloaded it. I answered the question and picked what my goals were. That gave me my caloric parameters. When I started writing down what I was eating I was shocked to see how wrong I was doing it. I no longer gorge myself on eggs, bacon, and cheese. I’m eating a more rounded diet. I plan my meals the day before I eat them, that way I know that I will stick to keto. You can also add and take away foods if you change your mind. You can also write down what your eating when your eating it. You log when it’s good for you. You can also log your weight, track your exercise, and even get recipes. This has been a great app for me and my journey with keto.

title: Great App but...
body: This app is great and i love using it and would pay for the premium if i could afford it. One huge problem though is that you have to check the nutrients on every single thing you  scan in because people seem to think putting in the wrong amounts makes things healthier 🤷🏻‍♀️🤷🏻‍♀️🤷🏻‍♀️ why lie to yourself. I even had one that took off 30 carbs! Im astounded people would lie to themselves. So either put in your own foods or double check the servings and nutrients so you dont think its healthier than it is. Other than that yes id recommend this app and premium. It works lovely with fitbit too. Syncs everything immediately so you have updated amounts based on your daily routine and any added exercise.

title: This app makes keto lifestyle simple
body: I am at a lost of words. At first I was trying to be cheap and use the free version. Then I purchased the advance subscription for a year and in the first two days I broke my plato because I was able to count my macros. I thought I would never understand the macro thing until now. Don’t disregard the macro counting ESPECIALLY if you’re using keto for weight lost. last but not least you can put in your own recipes. This is very useful if you are making meals for a large family because the app will help you keep track of your macros by entering your personal proportions size after you’ve login the full recipe. Long story short save yourself time energy and hassle and get this app!!!

title: Great free app!
body: I’m on week 2 of Keto and have been using the free version of Carb Manager. What a fantastic app! It helps me log my food and see how much fat, protein and carbs I have left for each day! It has have every type of food I’ve searched for so far, even Keto Connect recipes and nutritional info for a local low carb bakery in ATL. It gives me reminders to log in my meals a few times a day and I really feel this is helping keep my Keto on track and helping me learn nutritional values of foods that I eat. It also gives the foods a Keto rating grade, to let you know if it’s Keto friendly or not. And this is all free! I may upgrade to the paid version eventually when I get more involved in recipes, but I’m just keeping it pretty simple for now.

title: Fantastic app!
body: I used it extensively while I was doing keto. Then after I stopped, I tried switching to MyFitnessPal, and I found that it was almost unusable - covered in ads, and missing some basic functionality I've come to expect from a nutrition app. The pre-specified gradations of foods are super super useful, for example instead of saying "3 oz of cheese" I can just select "1 cracker size slice". This is ESSENTIAL for estimating nutritional content of meals you eat out! I'm shocked that more apps aren't doing this.

title: Where is support?
body: I love the app - it’s very intuitive- but I have a question and can’t seem to find the answer. I saw that one other person Siouxzee44 also had a q and hopefully they see this.... when you’re entering a recipe and you can’t save it - go to the top of your phone and de-select the position lock (prevents it from switching between landscape and portrait). I was having the same issue before I found out the fix by accident.
response: Thank you for taking the time to review our app! We’re sorry you've experienced a brief period where you were having issues accessing your account. We are happy to report the issue is resolved. Please contact us in-app directly via "Settings - Need Help" and reference your username so we can assist further. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Meh, Nickel & Dimes Everything
body: I used carb manager a few times and decided to try again after it was revamped. Easy to use but there’s just some areas that are incorrect or forcing to pay. A couple days totaled incorrectly even if quantities were adjusted. The fact that I can’t select a certain meal and add it to my log because it’s a “premium recipe” is ridiculous. How do you manage all the duplicates that were copied as “member recipes” because we couldn’t select it? Make it locked as a premium if users want the actual recipe but not if I already ate it and just trying to log it. In general, food and it’s recipes shouldn’t even be locked considering they’re available if searched through any browser and added for others to use. There’s so many other things that could be locked such as meal plans, but recipes?

title: Carb control
body: I have changed how I eat two years ago. The first year I did very well, in fact with each weigh-in I was either at a loss or a plateau, never a gain. Then I started having moments of “cheating” where I would spend a day or three eating whatever I wanted. I always gained and always felt sickly. I could not get back to the great place I was in at the beginning. This was partly because I felt I knew what to eat and as such didn’t keep tabs on my consumption of fats/carbs. Once I found this app I feel like I’m back on track to keeping a tighter control on my consumption. The app is easy to use and has great lists for plugging in your foods. I also like the scan feature. It helps me be more accountable to me.

title: Amazing KETO/ LOW CARB lifestyle app
body: This is the most detailed, up-to-date, useful Keto/ Low Carb app I’ve found. I’ve tried 4 different ones- which were all fine but lacked one thing or another until I found CarbManager. It has everything you need and more. It even has a place to enter ketone readings. This app will calculate your macros, customize your meal plans, provide recipes, give you access to helpful articles, etc. It is REALLY detailed; You can do a lot with it. You can track and log your goals, weight, body measurements, exercise, food, water, supplements, ketone readings, and even create/ log your own recipes and meals (although the library they have is seemingly endless). It’s great. Try for a month. It’s fantastic.

title: Wrong Calculations - Do not recommend for ketogenic dieters
body: I downloaded this app to help my boyfriend track his macros while he loses weight on Keto. The app told him he needed to consume 3007 calories a day. I knew this was wrong because that’s more than recommend amount for a normal diet, and you’re trying to lose weight you’re going to have to take some type of calorie deficit. I’ve also done Keto before so I knew just by the calories it was telling him to consume too much. Long story short looked online for some help and came across a program that lets you calculate what your daily macros would be while on keto, and it said he should be taking in 1779 calories a day. HUGE difference from 3007.
response: Thanks for contacting us! Could you message us via the Settings > Support Center? We can take a look at your account and see where the high calorie calculation came from. If a value like weight or height was entered incorrectly in your profile, the calculator may have used that value to arrive at the higher calorie goal. In any case, please contact us and we'll get it figured out!

title: This is amazingly easy
body: I had tried keeping track of all of the keto rules and adding them up and guessing at this and that and I was actually overdoing it on the calorie count so my weight-loss plateaued a lot. I paid for the premium upgrade and it is so easy it also suggests recipes that are quick and easy and super tasty things that I will probably include in my recipe plan for the rest of my life great substitutes that are very low or no carbAnd you can easily just keep track of what you eat and if you fall off the wagon eat a burger or fries it shows you how you can adjust your eating for the rest of the day so you don’t really destroy all your progress can’t speak highly enough about this it’s great

title: Great app but glitchy
body: I would give this app 5/5 if it wasn’t glitchy. I will find that sometimes this app will simply not load or open and then quit. I often times find that it happens at very inconvenient times like when I am trying to plan my meals for the day or pack my lunch. Sometimes I can close the app and reopen it a few times and it will work, other times it will not work for hours later. I love the app and it’s features but the glitches need to go in order to make it more reliable. I track my macros religiously to meet my weight goals and I need to be able to access the app all the times. This is especially frustrating because I have paid money for a premium membership and I cannot access the app sometimes due to glitches.

title: Best Thing I Ever Did for Myself Alongside Keto
body: I don’t know often write reviews but this app was recommended by some fellow Diet Doctor Keto followers. Carb Manager syncs with Diet Doctor

title: This is the best Keto / Carb app, period.
body: This is the only app I have found that gives complete control over food item inputs. No other app is this comprehensive and useful--they are always full of fluff and unnecessary features that takes individual control away from the user.

title: Everything I need in one place!
body: This is the best diet/nutrition type app that I have ever used - and I have tried plenty! I can track calories, carbs (total or net), protein, fat, fiber. PlusI can track my body measurements in addition to weight (which I have been looking for!). You can chose different meal plans depending on your preferences/needs & there are recipes which I love because I run out of ideas of what to eat. There’s even a budget friendly Keto meal plan! Also, I love the way the app gives each food a grade to indicate how Keto friendly it is.

title: Very good app for low carb dieters
body: I really like this app. It has been very helpful in keeping up with my macros as well as helping me determine my macro goals. The only reason I didn’t give it the fifth star is:

title: Really inaccurate
body: I would never consider upgrading to a paid version as trust me, having this over a year, you wouldn’t believe HOW MANY products are listed with inaccurate nutrition- carbs especially for them. That’s the main purpose of the app! To count carbs for Keto/low carb life stylers! I literally just scanned another one today that was wayyy off… usually fiber or sugar alcohols aren’t subtracted. Very inconsistent. For some I’ll just find a product that’s similar and put that as the food I ate rather than wasting so much time trying to update products, etc. which I have done before. The app is cumbersome to use, slow to find exercises, I don’t know I just don’t care for it failing at what may be its main purpose… to count carbs!! I held off reviewing until I just had yet another product that was wrong. Where’s the quality review team? Focus on quality to get people interested in spending money for your product!
response: Hi & thanks! We work hard on the accuracy of our Food DB. It's true some branded/processed foods have been input by users, so if there are inaccuracies, you can always Report a Food Error or make Quick Edits to them. Just reach out in-app, & we can help share how as well as how to identify our NCCDB verified foods to make it easier for logging!

title: Type 2 diabetes
body: I was told I was at risk for type 2 diabetes, so I knew I had to do something, but I thought, if I haven't figured it out by now how am I going to do it?  I decided to try this app for guidance and it's been a week, including Thanksgiving, and I lost 4 lbs.  I am still learning, but there is so much I don't understand, like I have know idea what a diabetic carb is!  Is it good or bad?  So I do wish for more info.  Also my Dr said to eat up to 45 carbs A MEAL, but this app encourages 44 carbs for the entire day!  So I'm assuming diabetic carbs are different.  Despite my lack of education about all this, the app does help me see what foods are good and which are best avoided and what the amount limits are.  For that I am grateful.

title: MFP vs CM
body: We’ve been using MFP for years now and are happy with it. We got a recommendation to try CM and so far I do like the easiness of seeing it all right there. Like the compatibility with other apps and devices. The best part for me is logging in my own recipes. MFP was ok in this, but I could never see how I made it, it was only the ingredients counter. Here you have it all! Love that feature. Also appreciate the recipes to inspire me to stay on track. Now to the bad - I find the database lacking a lot of foods that are easily found in MFP. If there is one thing that has to be improved this would be my suggestion. Also, when entering the amounts I liked how it can be decimal by typing not scrolling down a wheel of numbers. I thing that should change for the ease of input. Thank you for making this app worth the money ;)

title: This has SO much potential, but still needs work
body: At first I was overwhelmed with all the options and customization available on this app, but I dove right in and started trying things out. The many options for macros/plans and custom macros option are great.

title: Lacking number of servings option
body: Only had the app a few day. Takes a little getting used to not quite as user friendly as MyFitnessPal but has a lot of good options for carb watchers and keto dieting that the others don’t have.  So far my biggest grip is the option of putting number of servings. If I eat 5 servings of something out of the norm one time and let’s say the serving size is 27 grams or 27 ml.  I can’t just select 5 servings and the app adds it up.  I need to take the time and figure 27x5 and adjust it. One time no big deal but having to do this multiple time becomes a nuisance. You can always get around this by making it a custom food and adding all the ingredients etc etc. but I don’t want to do that if it’s only a one time thing.   Please add the option to select number of servings.

title: Love this APP
body: I love this App and have already lost 10lbs after only using it for a week and 1/2. The ease of use along with the ability to log weight, inches, macros, calories, and anything anyone would want or need to track make this a great app. The only complaint I have is the need to update some of the macros in some of the foods and an issue with the scanning of foods. Sometimes when I scan some items, it will not add the calories and the macros into my tracker so I needed to google the foods to make sure I was adding the correct information to my tracker. Other than that, absolutely no complaints. I have a lot more to lose and know this App will help me get to where I want to be.
response: Thanks so much for that great review, Busybelle! 10 lbs in two weeks is amazing, and shows the power of low carb/Keto eating. We'd love to hear more about the issues that you've run into with the scanner; our support team can likely get those sorted out for you. You can contact them in the app via Settings - Contact Support. Cheers!

title: Thought it was great at first.
body: Ok ... I totally loved this app when I started using it 4 days ago. I even gave up “myfitnesspal “ for this one. I even paid for the premium today so I could see my sodium. I thought to myself “this app is so great ; I want to give them $40 a year anyways just to support you guys.”  Now I’m starting to see a lot of errors when logging food. Like 3 net carbs for shrimp. Um... no. It even says in the nutrients info within the app when you scroll down that it is less than 1 gram. And if I edit the portion to correct the net carbs ; then all my other macros are off.  This is only one example. I’m finding numerous tnite. A lot of scanning Items and net carbs aren’t correct.
response: Hello from Carb Manager support and thank you for your review. We'd be delighted to take a look at the logging issues that you've encountered and offer some assistance. Additionally, we'd love the opportunity to review your macro settings to ensure you're set up for success. Please select "Need Help?" in-app and reference the username "Miya6" and we'll be happy to assist. Looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Great so far
body: I was using My Macros+, and that app I felt didn’t explain well enough how it made the calculations it did. I’m pretty sure it was misrepresenting my macros as better nutritionally than they were. This app, ahem, doesn’t sugarcoat my situation, and it lets me know immediately whether I am meeting the right goals, rather than just leaving me to interpret a 3-color pie chart. I also like that this one has a sort of color warning system for specific foods. Digging it so far.

title: Easy to use! More than a diet app!
body: I started out using this app to track my carbs. At my age (looking at 70, soon) I wanted to be more pro active in preventing many conditions that come with age and genetics. This app is perfect for me. I especially like how the scan feature helps me at the grocery store! I decided to purchase the upgraded version. Shortly after that, I was diagnosed with kidney disease. The upgraded version allows me to track the micronutrients that are now restricted in my menus! My numbers began to fall into almost normal range. My nephrologist was amazed at how well I was managing my dietary restrictions. When I told him about Carb Manager, he said he would look into it for several other patients. THANK YOU, CM.

title: Great app
body: This app has been great! It really allows me to keep track of everything I am taking in. I log everything down to the salt and pepper I add. It just makes me feel better knowing what I have made and what works. I look at it as a way to eventually have a meal plan that I love. So far, I have enjoyed everything I have eaten on this KETO Health Plan. My husband was having some medical issues and I decided to make it a healthy change for us both to keep him from being tempted by cravings. I’ve been on it for 2 weeks and have gone from 158 lbs to 151 lbs. I sure didn’t expect it to work so quickly, but it definitely motivates me to keep going. This app helps to keep me on track.

title: Wha? Why?
body: Yeeeah, if you could back in time and not do that one thing....  CM, for you it would be the update.  The layout is flashy but confusing. The food logs are off and don’t calculate the net carbs correctly. The iWatch no longer logs burned calories and macro adjustments. (Reached out to support and received crickets in reply) I’m disappointed to say the least. My SO is also completely underwhelmed with the app update. The original format worked wonders for our health.  Now I am basically using the app as a food log. Sadness overwhelms me. At least it was only a 3 month subscription purchase when it was on sale. (Thusly canceling) There should be a stress level section so I can input it going up every time I log onto the app.  PS I love all the Devs putting up 5 star reviews trying to save the sinking ship.  If you’re using supportive formal robotic language in your description of the features of the app... You’re faking it.

title: Makes all the difference!!
body: I have attempted the Keto diet (admittedly not the strictest adherence) several times with decent results. I had never really calculated macros or really counted anything but carbs. This time, I am using Carb Manager and it has made all the difference!! I see exactly how many carbs, calories, fat, protein, etc I need to take in for the day and keeping to this formula I have lost weight much faster. It’s really helped me see why I wasn’t as successful with my previous attempts. Every food I’ve searched for so far has been preloaded into the app so it’s easy to know the nutritional information for everything I’m eating. Have recommended this app to many family members and friends!!

title: A good job, but, wildly overpriced.
body: Update 2: 1 to four stars.  Good customer service.

title: Great visual representation of nutrition
body: I started using this app a few weeks ago. I love the visual representation of my day. I’m not sticking to the plan how I should, but the blame for that is on me, not the program. I know if I do it right and actually get the exercise I need, I will see great results. Like everything else, I need discipline to follow through. The pie chart representation is nice for the macros of what you have eaten for the day. Then for your progress to your daily calorie allowance you follow a bar that shows your total calorie allowance and how many you’ve had so far. When I open the app throughout the day it opens to the correct page where i can see at a glance how my day is going. Great app!

title: Best Keto / LCHF App in World
body: This app is so strong and so easy to use! I actually bought it by mistake in August 2018 without reading any reviews or checking it out and was totally annoyed at myself. So, then I started using it and now I’m a huge fan.  I have little patience and I don’t like having to take time to figure out an interface for data. The  foods and water tracking entry process is super fast and visually intuitive, the database is impressively vast and it is really simple to add a recipe or import one from its url. Also, there are a whole bunch of premium recipes - the ones I’ve tried have been favorites. I’ve been Keto / LCHF for 5 years and this app is the best I’ve seen for tracking. Thanks!

title: User friendly and detailed
body: So far I love everything about this FREE app. For me counting carbs has proven more effective than counting calories. I’ve used a couple of calorie counting apps in the past and a recipe app to calculate nutrition. I used  another carb counting app before I found this one. The other app didn’t have many features and not many food options to search from.

title: Unable to sync Fitbit...ugh! - re-review
body: Initially I gave this app 2 stars for my issue below. The support center reached out to me today (2 days after my request). This was the response: “ Hi there, There have been updates to the new version of the app for syncing fitness devices!”. So it seems to me like I purchased the app during this upgrade period and it took a while to finally update for me. Either way, I’m very happy with Carb Manager! I look forward to losing weight with this app.
response: Hi Nadia, that doesn't sound like normal app behavior at all - please reach out to our friendly Support team in-app via Settings → Help & Support and they'll help get your Premium features back and connect that Fitbit.

title: New Update Is Awful
body: Carb Manager just completely updated their app (without giving notice to users...which is really harsh). The new “updated” app is cumbersome and takes a long time to open. It is very difficult to navigate and and saved foods/recipes are not organized in any helpful way. Also the visuals of daily progress of goals is now circles...which makes no sense.  How do you indicate on a circle if you go over your carb/fat/calorie goal...well you can’t is the answer..(this really makes no sense and was clearly designed by people who don’t actually use or understand the app). There is also no visual way to measure your actual daily progress against your goals....again the circles are worthless. The “old” interface was easy and intuitive. I wish the new update made sense but it’s like replacing an Audi with a golf cart and saying it drives better. The new updated app a big No thanks
response: Hi there! We are so grateful for your long time support. First, rest assured that our developers are working quickly to tune the new version of the app. We also understand that many users have grown very familiar with the former app version and that the update is a big adjustment. Please don't hesitate to reach out to our support team (Settings → Help & Support) if we can help with anything specific!

title: Good, Could Be Great
body: This app works pretty well if you use it as a stand-alone app. It has a lot of features for tracking intermittent fasting, etc. I subscribe to the premium features for access to the recipes, so I also think it’s worth the money. That said, it has two bad issues, each worth a star off:
response: Hi there - thanks for the review and the feedback. We do suggest - and many users do this - that you use the "custom meal" feature for groupings of foods that you regularly eat together, but aren't necessarily a single recipe. Eg eggs + avocado + Keto coffee for breakfast, saved as a "custom meal" which you'll find under the three vertical dots beside any meal section on the Daily Log. Hope that's helpful.

title: Just okay
body: The new interface is okay but they didn’t actually improve anything, and made some things worse.
response: Hi there! It's actually possible to filter out member-created foods. Please reach out in the app via Settings → Help & Support for more information. We're not able to reproduce the issue with the clock covering the meal when you copy a food from one meal to another. We'd love to help you troubleshoot! Again, don't hesitate to reach out. Cheers!

title: Awesome tracking app!
body: I love this app! It makes it so easy to track my meals, with great features like Favorites, super flexible portion sizes (weights, volumes, number, etc). The defaults for most foods are fairly typical, like 2 eggs or 1 cup of veggies. The UPC scanner is killer--just press the button, aim in the direction of the UPC and bam! it has read every item I've put to it so far!

title: This app is amazing
body: I had downloaded this app awhile ago but used another food tracking app until recently.  I decided to give this one a try, and am very happy that I did.  I like the way that the app tracks carbs and, especially, that it allows you to track vitamin supplements.  There are many other health-related factors that can be tracked besides weight, and this feature is very useful to me.  When using the other app, I was wishing that it included certain features.  My regret about this one is that I didn’t give it a closer look earlier - all the features that I want in a nutrition and physical well-being app are included in Carb Manager.  Outstanding!

title: Great keto/carb tracking app!
body: I love this app. It really takes the guesswork out of carb tracking, especially with net carbs. It is very user friendly. The free version is fantastic but the paid version is more than worth the small yearly fee (or monthly if you’re not big into commitment). I always hesitate to try out new tracking apps because I find most food data bases lag far behind MFP. I have not come across one food in the last two weeks that wasn’t in their data base! So far, I would say the data base is totally on par with MFP, the customization is easier and more thorough than MFP, and the premium subscription is cheaper than MFP.  Carb Manager is now my tracking app of choice!

title: Carb manager
body: This program is awesome.  I asked a question the other day and a lady named Kaela responded quickly and answered my question. Very nicely done.

title: Great app!
body: I wanted to start Keto but didn’t know where to start. I didn’t have the time to calculate all the macros of recipes and find ones that work together to hit my goals every day. This app does it all!! I can choose which recipes I want and it’ll arrange it through the week along with snacks to make it all work. Then it makes a shopping list for me to make it even easier!!! My only complaint is the categories of the shopping list. Garlic has its own category. Kind of weird when it’s with the produce. Also, pork chops were listed under bone, not meat. It’s all in the same place at the store so I don’t know why it’s separated on the list. But all together this app is awesome!!

title: The best
body: I used this app while doing keto a few years ago and I am now using to track my macro nutrients. I tried Weight Watchers but I like to know all the nutrients that I am consuming. This app has some many features that I am about to purchase premium, but even using it for free us everything I need right now, tracking nutrients, linked to apple health to track my steps, and the best feature of all is the scanner where you just scan the barcode on the food you eat and everything pops up. My girlfriend and I are trying to live a healthier lifestyle and this app is a big eye opener on the foods we eat and it helps to keep ourselves accountable and make better decisions.

title: LIVE this app
body: I LIVE this app.  No, that's not a typo...but I do love it too.  I "live" it every day to log food, look up foods before I eat them, get recipes, and stay motivated.

title: A must for any diet
body: I’ve been using this app daily for over a year now and it’s just an amazing tool! I find it very intuitive to use and very informative.  I think the fact that I can create a recipe, save it and then instantly see that recipe available with all the macros already figured up is amazing! If you’re on the fence about the premium service remember this. If you have a Fitbit, Garmin, iPhone or iwatch you can sync it to the Carb Manager app. Any exercise you then do will automatically chance you daily requirements based on calories burned. To me that alone is worth it. Not to mention the extensive list of recipes and advanced features. This is an app that won’t disappoint.

title: Love the old app..can’t log into new one
body: I loved the old app but recently updated it.  I have not been able to log into the new app.  It keep telling me A PROBLEM HAS BEEN FOUND across the bottom.  At first it didn’t recognize my password so I just changed it.  Now nothing. I am able to use the new password on my desktop so I’m logging and using the subscription it’s just inconvenient to not be able to use the phone.
response: Hey there - sorry to hear you're experiencing these issues logging in. If you haven't yet, please reach out to support@carbmanager.com with the email address associated with your account, and they can help you troubleshoot and get back into the app on mobile!

title: Excellent resource
body: Started my keto journey a little over two months ago with the carb manager app and can not recommend it enough. Everything that I eat goes into carb manager and wow is it enlightening. The app keeps me absolutely on track and I know for sure I could not just estimate my macros accurately. The upgrade (paid) version is a must as it makes all the brand names available as well as great recipes. I honestly believe the app has kept me going on keto. For informations sake- I am doing keto for body composition and metabolic purposes, weight lift frequently, etc. but for anyone trying to loose weight you MUST count your macros and carb manager makes it so easy!! Highly recommended.

title: Requires work
body: This app needs full 2 way interface with Health app.. I was unpleasantly surprised that if I record my weight in app it does not get updated in Health app. Current weight in Health app is used to calculate calories burned during exercise .. other apps do that !  Plus this app hasn’t been updated for 5 months.. this is not a good sign.. Some work needs to be done about recording weight of foods. If I want to record 300 g of something i need to convert it to oz first because wheel with number goes only up to 100. Plus using fractions instead of decimals is another flaw. I hope this stupid number wheel will be converted to digital pad..
response: Hey there, and thanks for sharing your feedback. You can definitely change your pinwheel to a keyboard to enter food measurements above 99 more easily and accurately. For the other issues you are experiencing, please reach out to us from within the app and would be happy to assist you!

title: Free Trial for an Overpriced App
body: As others have mentioned, the app starts restricting how much you can do over time in order to get you to go premium. I’m disappointed I no longer have use of the same features I did when I downloaded it. I wouldn’t mind paying to upgrade the app if it weren’t a subscription service. Honestly, what a joke. For that price, I can go back to My Fitness Pal. Just have users pay $20-30 one time to unlock all daily tracking services and done. I don’t care about fancy menus and all the other nonsense that I’d be paying $40-$100/year for depending on my subscription. The daily tracking is so handy but I feel like they’re going overboard trying to wring users out of their money. I won’t be upgrading, and I’ll be looking elsewhere for macro tracking.

title: Great when trying to follow low carb
body: This app is great as I was looking to track my carbs. I like how at the top it gives me how many grams of fat and protein I have left and well as my calories count. There’s a decent size database and allows you to add your own recipes.

title: Amazing!!
body: This app makes tracking food and tracking macros SO easy!!! HUGE database of foods, 99% of food that I scan show up. The developers have thought of every little detail to make your life easier- entering a recipe and calculating the calories and macros for you, being able to copy anything (one food, one recipe, all your foods for a particular meal, etc) to a different day, even adjusting the visuals to the way you like it. This is seriously an amazing app!! Note- I did spend the money on the premier subscription almost immediately so I’m not sure which features are included and which are not but if you’re considering it, it’s definitely worth the money!

title: This is exactly the kind of health app I’ve been looking for!
body: For free with this app you get easy macro tracking with a comprehensive database of foods and their nutrition facts, including the option to scan a barcode of the food you eat. You can also track your exercise with a nice built in list of exercises to choose from (though I’d enjoy more exercises added for the workouts I do). Hydration and sleep schedule are also trackable too, as well as weight. I haven’t tried the paid version yet, and the meal planning and data analysis options are very tempting, but I’m turned off by the fact that it’s a monthly fee and not a one-time purchase. I’m enjoying the free version though and it fulfills most of what I need!

title: Keto Macro app is a game changer
body: I was doing well on Keto but not great and admittedly a bit overwhelmed by many new concepts and food prep as well as getting my initial grocery shopping lists and items together to support this new journey.  I’ve read a lot and watched many videos and clearly doing Keto the best way includes ensuring you count your macros.  Now that I’ve been diligent with using this app, I better understand-I would say starting Keto is a totally life changing process and using the app is great but could be a bit too much at the very beginning if someone wasn’t at all familiar.  My suggestion would be 30-60 days into the Keto journey for someone new to Keto.  Great app thank you.

title: Best app for Keto/Low Carb out there
body: I’ve used sone other general nutrition/weight loss tracking apps over the years and have my tried and true go to, but when I decided to change to the keto lifestyle it was cumbersome to use.  I found a lot of different apps labeled keto and low carb and by far this one is hands down the best. I’m still on the free version and it honestly meets all my needs and I haven’t found any negatives so far. Once in a blue moon there may be a good I don’t find but I can enter that on. I’m definitely planning to upgrade to premium for the added benes. For anyone new to keto I would definitely recommend this app to really help you stay on track.
response: Now that's a glowing review. Thanks so much, Suzy! We really appreciate you. There are plenty of other fitness apps out there, but we're pretty sure that we're the most robust Keto/Low carb specific app on the market. Thrilled to hear that you're thinking about Premium! While the free version has all of the basics to succeed with Keto, Premium users typically report 3X the results of Premium users. Let us know if we can ever help with anything else!

title: Not as good as ratings
body: Having used other apps like this before, I wanted to try something new at the suggestion of a friend. I upgraded to the premium version to access meal plans and recipes. First problem I had is if you tap to generate a plan you have to wait because there is delay. Didn’t realize this because I tapped again and it brought me all the way to the beginning and I lost the customized plan that took me 40minutes to build after going through looking at all the recipes and such. Then I lost time again after finally getting a plan to finding where it is. It doesn’t really give you the portions or tell you how much you should be consuming based on the macros in the plan. Overall disappointed I paid for 3 months and I won’t be using this crap! No trial period so you are just hosed! Good idea but bad mobile rollout in my opinion. Wouldn’t recommend!
response: Hi there, and thanks for leaving us constructive feedback! The issue you are having is definitely not normal app behavior. Please allow us the opportunity to look into this further by messaging us from within the app or emailing us at support@carbmanager.com.

title: I love this app, but it’s sooooo sloooow
body: I really love using this app, but for some reason it is significantly (and frustratingly) slower than every other app on my phone. It takes FOREVER to input my information because I’m constantly waiting for the app to catch up. Another thing that drives me crazy is that when I switch to a different window (I’m using an iPhone) to check the macros for a recipe so that I can input it, when I switch back to Carb Manager, it kicks me all the way out to the main menu and I lose anything I’ve already entered.

title: New version of the app has so many bugs
body: All in all, it’s a competent app, but this new version behaves like it’s still in beta, and it’s much more of a hassle for me to log my foods in now. The barcode scanner refuses to scan some barcodes, and will sometimes even crash the app, which never used to happen. The old version used to save all of my frequently eaten or recently viewed foods so nicely, and now insists to push “my foods”, recipes I created for a one-time log over a year and a half ago back in my face. Or it will glitch and populate the same 8 recently viewed foods in an infinite loop. Forget about logging in a recipe if you need to switch tabs, it will crash out. It needs so much more recoding before it resembles anything like a stable version again.

title: New version problematic
body: **EDIT: I posted a review and have seen lots of similar issues. I was able to resolve most of the problems by deleting, then reinstalling the app. Good luck!**
response: Hi there - thanks for the updated review, feedback, and sharing that tip with others. It's like the delete/reinstall forced your app to update to the latest version, with many fixes and updates. Glad to hear things are working for you now!

title: Game changer
body: If you are serious about Keto, or any change of your diet this is a must have app. The free version is good enough, but if you are serious about changing your diet; less than $5 a month should be a no brainer. The app allows you to log your food various ways and does a great job in breaking your meals and food down to see where your diet can improve. It does take a short time to log, but it can be eye opening to see how much is really in the food we eat. If you truly value the opportunity you have to change your life through your diet. The time and money will be nothing in comparison to what you can get out of this app.

title: Great for keto diet
body: This app allows you to track almost everything related to your diet and health. I’ve started to use this on 8/12 and today is 8/20 and so far I’ve lost 6 lbs , granted that I’ve incorporated 15,000 steps per day which also contributed to the weight loss. I gave it a 4 star because when you are creating your own recipe and make a mistake, you cannot move the cursor to where the error is. Instead, you have to place it at the end of that sentence or line and hit the backspace until you get to the error. It’s a bit annoying. Otherwise, I live this app. I would recommend to anyone on a keto diet plan or trying to control sugar.

title: Changed my life
body: Since the time I have started logging in my macros with this app, I am so watchful of what I eat. I always try to stick to my caloric goals as week as macro goals. I love how you can not just see the caloric consumption but also the grams equivalent and helps you to choose your macro ratios for specific days. It contains almost all food plus the scan feature really helps.

title: I want to give 5 stars but...
body: The meal planner is a fabulous idea, and love that it spits out a shopping list. However, it's practically unusable due to a glitch. When I go to plan for say, Monday breakfast, I enter a food, add to the day, and then expect to be able to continue doing so. However, when I attempt too enter the next food, it switches back to today. When I go back to meal planner, I must first click on another day, THEN back on my original Monday planner to get it to work. So frustrating I'm about to give it up and cancel my membership. Another glitch I'm having is that no matter hope many times I try to adjust my daily macros (I carb cycle), they don't "stick". Perhaps the developer has a solution?

title: Review
body: I’ve used Carb Manager for about 2yrs. I’ve tried other health apps before but I keep going back to Carb Manager. I’m almost 60 and I find it one of the most user friendly health apps out there.  It’s not only for keto dieters but for anyone who wants to keep track of their carbohydrate intake. I love the pie chart, the tracking chart showing my weight loss and the comment section. I like to type in a little note on how the day went and the weight chart give me inspiration when I see my weight trending down. If your new to theses type of apps I would recommend Carb Manager. I’ve shared it with my daughter and son in law and they now are both using it.

title: Not liking the Feb 2021 Update
body: I LOVED this app. It was user friendly and visually easy to locate items to log. I loved how easy it was to create recipes and have the macros calculated, I could easily read the graphs to track my glucose and etc.   But I’m NOT A FAN of the recent update! I lost data, it’s taking me longer to find my custom food items and there seems to be more steps to log meals etc.   Visually it’s harder to see things at a glance. I’m not sure how long I will stay with this app after this update. I will be searching for another app that is more user friendly, more visually appealing and meeting my tracking needs. ... which is a bummer because I LOVED this app!

title: Love it so far!
body: I have only had this app for a week and after a few days I did buy the paid version (I really needed all the extra help!). Totally worth it so far!! I have lost 4 lbs this week because I am staying on target!! I love all the ways I can track what I am doing, and I have not even really dug into the recipes yet due to time constraints, but definitely will! This app really is perfect if you are doing keto. Five stars from me! Thanks for this great app! My only wish is that I could at least access My Foods data I have added and add meals/info even if off line. Then it could update/sync when back online. That would be a phenomenal update!!

title: I couldn’t do Keto without it!!
body: I have lost 30 pounds in 3 months!! I have tried so many times to go low carb in the past 25 years and have not been that successful. But with Carb Manager and the right state of mind to lose weight, I have gone down to my weight when I got married 30 years ago!! Carb Manager is so easy to use and in valuable when going Keto. I will continue to use it when I go on a low carb maintenance plan. Carb Manager is flexible and customizable to how you want to lose weight and how fast. Being able to input recipes and scanning grocery product was awesome. Great app and couldn’t have lost the weight without it!

title: Information Central!
body: This is the best app I have come across for tracking nutrition.  Even if you are not doing Keto you still get a fabulous nutrition breakdown.  I love that I can see the day to day impact from more than the macronutrients we track for Keto.

title: Amazing w/ a few exceptions..
body: NEGATIVES:
response: Hey there! Thanks so much for that detailed review and for the great rating. Glad to hear that the app is working out so well for you :-) With regard to the list "jittering" and duplicate food entries, we'd love to have the opportunity to troubleshoot. Just reach out to our support team in the app via Settings - Contact Support and they'll be happy to assist.

title: Best app ever!
body: Started the Keto diet 2 weeks ago and needed a good way to keep track of carbs. I was using another weight loss app but didn’t feel I was getting the most accurate information. Then I found Carb Manager! Not only has it helped me manage my carb intake, but also helps me see my fat goals and protein goals. I found some errors in my meal planning and was able to make the necessary changes thanks to this app! I love that I can scan the foods I eat which makes logging very easy. As well as being able to create my own recipes and save to my favorites. Considering going premium so I can see what else this awesome app has to offer!

title: The best for Keto
body: After checking out most of the other apps available for iPhone decided to download this. So very happy. Reviews are originally what sold me on it but then I started using it and was completely sold. I didn’t go premium until using it for a couple days and still went back to check the other apps to make sure that it would be worth the money. Absolutely worth it!  Very very happy. This app is truly  the best. Believe me you will try it too and see. There are some pretty awful ones available. Highly recommend  CM.  I know this app will keep me on my keto original goal and beyond and it’s so easy to use. Loving!

title: Best Keto App Available
body: This app has made my journey into Keto smooth and simple. I attempted to use a few other apps, and this one is by far the most user friendly. It has a lot of realistic recipes that I actually want to eat and doesn’t take half a day to prepare. I’ve tried about 7 recipes so far and each one has been good or great!
response: Hi there, thanks for the awesome feedback! We're delighted that your loving the app! To answer your questions: the notifications are the "app badge" that show your carbs for the day. You can turn them off by going to Settings > App Badge. To set your macros based on your weight loss goals, please go to Settings > Macros. Thanks and enjoy.

title: Thanks for the App.
body: I started the keto lifestyle December 20, 2018. The first two days were grueling trying to calculate everything on paper. I then discovered the Carb Manager app. Thank you for the this App. Without it it would be very difficult. I’ve been to amusement parks and I’m able to use it to locate keto friendly food. Or use it on all my travels. I travel a lot for work. I do not know how it compares to other apps, as I have no need to go look. This app fits everything I need to look up and use. I am using the freeware version. So far I have not needed to switch to premium. But I may try it out to see what’s so different. Great job keep it up!

title: Incredible App!
body: Bravo to the programmer(s) who put this app together. It’s the best app I have ever used, just wish I would have found it sooner. I have been on a keto low carb diet for a year and lost 42 pounds. Found this app and now I am doubling my monthly rate of weight loss from an average of 3.5 pounds a month to 7 pounds a month. This app is so easy and educational to use. You don’t have to be on a keto low carb diet to benefit from using it as it tracks calories too. I find it enjoyable to use and can’t wait each morning to put in my new weight and what I had for breakfast and other meals and see my glide path to my goals. Congratulations to the programmers!

title: Not an easy tool anymore
body: I loved this app before the latest update.  Now it takes me so long to find the features I use most.  I loved being able to weigh my food and enter the amount with a keyboard that let me use decimals. That’s gone.  And I loved that the foods I eat the most were right there.  Now I have to touch at least three tabs to get to that feature.  When I’m adding my foods, the “wheels” are so close to each other I tend to change the measurement wheel without noticing.

title: Great EASY app to use!
body: I did Keto last year with some good success. Returning to Keto was a little tough, but finding this app to track food, water and activity is a WINNER! My first two weeks, I was a little reluctant but this is SO easy! It gives me a great view of my daily habits and choices and how they can affect my success. So many foods are preloaded and not just individual foods, but something like instant rice with chicken bouillon (not a good choice!), different size tomatoes and even measurements just as you would use in recipes. The detail is wonderful! Thanks for making a great app that I look forward to using to help me work my way to the best year and best health ever!

title: Best app I’ve ever use to a low carb diet
body: I’ve been on and off a low carb diet for at least the last 20 years. I’ve also tried many different ways to keep track of what and how much I’ve consumed. By far this app provides a ton more information and allows me to add recipes as I find new recipes or create recipes myself. Not only can I keep track so much easier than ever before but this app provides recipes, allows me to add recipes from the web, and gives me credit for my workouts. This app really is everything I could hope for in tracking my carbs, needing information to be successful in my journey to stay healthy.

title: Feeling duped
body: I tried several keto tracker apps and finally decided to go premium with CarbManager.  It appeared to have pretty much everything I wanted in an app for keto tracking. I was extremely disappointed when I went to print off a recipe so my husband would be able to prepare it because I’d be working late. Unfortunately the print option did nothing except to tell me I’d need to go to the website version to print. When I did that and signed in my account did not come up it acted as if I was a new person needing to start all over again. Hence no way to print the recipe. I was even more disappointed when I found no way to contact anyone to rectify this situation. My only recourse has been to leave this review. I wont be renewing my subscription, very disappointing and feel duped unfortunately.
response: Hello from Carb Manager support and thank you for your review. We're sorry to hear you've run into an issue working with recipes from within the Carb Manager app recently. Our team would love to offer some suggestions to help alleviate this issue. Please select "Need Help?" in-app and reference your username and we'll be happy to assist. Thank you!

title: Life Changer
body: I’m 59. I’ve had Type I Diabetes for 46 years. I’ve been eating Keto foods for three years but have struggled to get the % of macros right, maintain tight blood sugar control and stay in ketosis.—-Not any more.—-I can literally record my food, glucose, insulin and many other facts within minutes. The % of macros is updated with each food item.  I can print it and bring to my dr. I am not tech friendly and I managed to teach myself and navigate in a couple hours.  This app will extend my life because it has simplified and accelerated the recording of everything: And that means I do it ALL DAY LONG. Every day. That’s the difference. That’s a life changer.

title: Better than MFP for keto!
body: This app is awesome for keto! I know essentially apps do the same thing if they have a large enough data base... but this app is geared towards low carb and I can see my info really quickly and know if I’m track. Open it, and I automatically see my net carbs. That is essentially what made me switch from my fitness pal (I have to scroll... open my macros... do the math myself... much longer. Love seeing my net carbs right away).

title: In LOVE
body: I was training for another figure competition and my trainer had me on a “kind of” Keto plan. My meal plan was “Keto” like for 2 of the many weeks of my training. Every week I had to take progress pics and the weeks end my Keto plan was where I saw the better results. So after my competition I added carbs back for 2 weeks and then went straight Keto. I lost more weight than the app anticipated. At a high activity level, I was expected to lose 2 lbs a week. I weighed in at 150.5 on a Saturday and by Friday I was down to 144.5. I wanted to maintain 145 so hopefully the maintenance phase I’m on will keep me at this weight. Otherwise I’ll be forced to eat more. LOL!

title: Best app for Keto lifestyle management
body: This app is the best by far keto lifestyle management tool that I’ve seen in the App Store. Having said that, I was able to track all the carbohydrates that I put into my body as well as sodium, fats and proteins. The only issue I have with this app is the price. I personally think it’s too high for an app. But in carb managers defense all the other apps for keto or diet... price around the same range. I am only using the free version at this time, I think I am going to pull the trigger and buy a subscription to the app because I do think it’s a great tool that I need in my arsenal. Paradise ain't free, all of the high-quality things have to be paid for in order for you to enjoy them.

title: Two major issues with most recent update
body: Overall, I love this app! But in order to hopefully get the devs attention, 1 Star is where it stands for now. I have two major issues:
response: Hi there - thanks for the feedback, we are indeed listening and making many updates to the app based on user feedback. If it helps at all you can always add your most-logged foods to "Favorites" by tapping the heart icon on a food's page. There's also the "Quick Find" tab which brings up "Favorites" and "Recently Viewed" tabs. If you find those to be inaccurate, please reach out via Settings → Help & Support and we can troubleshoot what may be going on for you.

title: Latest Update is Awful
body: I have the Premium subscription and have been a user since September 2020.  I had a meal plan in place for the week and after the recent update, I went to update portions in a meal and the app showed some outrageous numbers that throw off my macros.  For example, it came up with 800 grams of fat for 28 grams of pecans????? I’ve tried different ways of selecting other serving sizes to work around this and it produces the same result.  I can’t live like this.  I count on this app for a daily record of my meal plan and I expect it to be accurate.  I’m about to message Customer Service.  This bug needs to be fixed immediately.  I’m not going to tolerate this for much longer.

title: Bought Premium, Can’t Access
body: Well I’m apparently in a small minority but don’t love the app. Can not configure. I paid for the premium subscription but could never access premium features. It just kept telling me “sign up for Premium” when I went to access recipes, etc.
response: Hi there, so sorry to hear you experienced these issues getting started with Premium! If you reach out to our friendly Support team either via support@carbmanager.com or in-app via Settings → Help & Support we can troubleshoot for you, include your app store username for the quickest reply.

title: App updates
body: I have used this app for 2 years.  It has really helped me to stay on point getting closer to achieving my goals.  I haven’t had a problem until the last update.  I just figured out what happened. When it updated it changed the calorie counter to subtract my burned calories.  That is not what I want and when you update you shouldn’t just make changes to someone’s program.  Also it was quite difficult to find the area to fix the issue.  I have been racking my brain trying to figure out what I was doing different.  Turns out I was going over my limits because the app was subtracting what I was burning.  Don’t do that to people.  When you do an update, simply do a tutorial to show what is new, different, or better and allow the user to decide.
response: Hi there, and thanks for your review! You can change this setting easily under App Settings! If you haver any other questions, the fastest and most efficient way to assist you is to reach out directly within the app or email us at support@carbmanager.com. Our Customer Support Team is ready to help!

title: Beware
body: I tried to cancel my Premium subscription for the last two days, and the account wouldn’t let me (maybe a glitch in the system, or by design to milk another year’s pay out of the customer?). I contacted the company via email this morning, and this afternoon they charged me for another year. Beware of this company.
response: Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts. Really sorry to hear that you found canceling to be a hassle. We've done everything that we can to make it as quick and easy as possible. All that's required to cancel is to go to Settings/Account Setting/Manage Subscription. If you need additional assistance from our fully staffed Support Team, please reach out to us at support@carbmanager.com and reference your app review username, and they will be happy to assist you with your cancelation.

title: Best app ever for weight loss and management
body: I previously used 3 apps to do what Carb manager does. I tried the free version and definitely saw the value of premium. I use it every day. I manage ketones, fasting, meals, weight, measurements water and I can import recipes plus review easy and very good recipes. It has meal plans, grocery lists, corny contests😬, and even lets me know what I can eat with what macros I have left. Oh and the coolest part is that it is one size fits all! Whether you are on keto, keto cycling, regular, building muscle, you name it you can add in what ratios you want. I’ve lost 35 lbs so far for the year and 22 of that was just in the 4 months using the app!

title: One of best apps I use
body: Fantastic app and it works quite well with either Fitbit devices or an Apple Watch. Love the tracking of daily levels for diabetes and love the option to add custom recipes.

title: It’s a good app but essentially a free trial
