response: Thanks for the great review. Yep, there's a lot to love with the free version alone! Many users are able to reach their health goals using the free version of Carb Manager. If/when you're ready, the Premium version makes it even faster & easier to succeed with Keto, with features like the "auto-magic" Snap function, hundreds of thousands of premium recipes, meal planning, shopping lists, educational resources, and more! Let us know if we can ever help you with anything :-)

title: Easy to use

body: This works so much better than My Fitness Pal, not just for keto purposes (net carbs  vs total carbs options built right in!), but also just as an app.  MUCH faster than MFP.

title: Inconsistent
body: I found over time many inconsistencies, ie grams of carbs in black coffee vary, I didn’t think coffee had any carbs, but at least be consistent. But worse to me is the ap doesn’t always add up the carbs correctly. How this happens I don’t know but it does. It is just too unreliable. I was using the free version. Maybe if you buy the monthly service it works.
response: Hi there - thanks for the note! So coffee does actually have a small amount of carbs in the form of fiber (little known fact). The adding issue is likely due to rounding, as we don't round values before we add them, but do round them after. To see the full decimal values, please go to Settings > Show Decimal Values. Not sure why you're seeing different values for the same food -- please drop us a line at support@carbmanager.com and we'll help figure out what's happening. Thanks!

title: Best app ever!

body: This app is absolutely incredible. Download this if you’re looking to lose weight.

title: Vitamin/Mineral content inaccurate
body: It seems that users can edit macronutrients at will to reflect whatever they want so you need to cross check everything you log. A lot of the amounts listed are wildly inaccurate so don’t count on this if you’re tracking vitamins/minerals.
response: Hi & thanks! We work hard on the accuracy of our Food DB. It's true some branded/processed foods have been input by users, so if there are inaccuracies, you can always Report a Food Error or make Quick Edits to them. Just reach out in-app, & we can help share how as well as how to identify our NCCDB verified foods to make it easier for logging!

title: Easy and efficient
body: Really happy with my ability to use this app quickly and accurately.

title: Wow

I will switch back to MyFitnessPal where it is free to import recipes. Change this feature and I’d be in for life.
response: Hi and we're happy you love our app! Premium members can import recipes from other websites by selecting Foods - Recipes & Meal Plans - Import Recipe. For any other questions, please let us help by selecting Settings - "Need help?" in-app. Thanks!

response: Congratulations on your amazing progress! We're proud to be a part of the journey. Message us in-app anytime if we can be of further help along the way. Have a great day!

title: Easy to use

title: Not accurate
body: Sorry, no, but you don’t get a free pass based on BS reviews. This app counts sugar alcohols in net carbs, which is inaccurate, and makes it look like my daily net is 25g, when it’s probably less than 10. You can’t call this a keto friendly app if it uses flawed measurements.
response: Hi there and thanks for the review. Fiber & Sugar Alcohols are substracted from our Net Carbs. To make sure you're tracking Net Carbs, please select Settings - Carbs to Track. For further information, please search our KB for "sugar alcohols" or reach out to our support team at support@carbmanager.com and we'd be happy to check out your account and help. Thanks!

title: Disappointed
body: Tried to familiarize myself with the app but ads for premium kept popping up.  Tried to get out of the page and was charged within minutes a month subscription.  Cancelled immediately, still charged!  Won’t use app if not user friendly!
response: Hi! The pop-up to upgrade should only appear 1x a day or when trying to use Premium features. If you think it's happening more or would like to request a refund, please reach out in-app. We're happy to offer the free app to as many users as possible. We hope that you continue to enjoy.

title: Lifesaver!

title: Not worth it if you don’t pay
body: Maybe there’s just a learning curve to this app but so far it doesn’t seem worth using if you don’t buy Premium. Can’t use most of the features. Very small food selection for daily logging. Pretty glitchy too. Just started keto and was really hoping this would help...
response: Hey there, and congrats on starting your Keto journey! Thanks for your feedback. Our core app is free and always will be. Most of our users reach their goals without ever upgrading to Premium. Our Premium version is there for users who want access to advanced features like fitness device integrations, premium recipes, and more, but both versions find success stories! Reach out to us in-app and we can share more about our Free features.

response: Excited to hear that you're loving the app, Saligasa. A Spanish language version is definitely on our roadmap!

response: Hey there! Thanks for your feedback. Our core app is free and always will be. In fact, we don't offer a trial of our Premium because we always let our users choose for themselves. Many of our users reach their goals without ever upgrading to Premium. Our Premium version is there for users who want access to advanced features like fitness device integrations, premium recipes, and more, but both versions find success stories!

response: Hey Josey - Thanks so much for taking the time to leave a detailed review! Our free-forever version is feature-rich, and includes unlimited food logging, barcode scanning, weekly challenges, exercise & water tracking, and web-based recipes. The Premium version is available for advanced users, and includes additional features like meal plans, advanced analysis, premium recipes, advanced settings and more. If you're having trouble with the free recipes please reach out at support@carbmanager.com

title: Bad for beginner Keto
body: Very difficult to navigate. Takes forever to log meals, overly complicated and not user friendly. You cannot get a refund either. I requested a refund the day after I bought it and was told instantly no refunds of any kind are offered. That tells you all you need to know about it.
response: Hi, thanks for sharing your experience. We'd love to offer some tips to make navigating the app as smooth as possible. Just reach out to us in-app by selecting Settings -"Need help?" and we can offer a hand. If you're still interested in a refund, we can definitely process that as well. Our flexible refund policy can be found in our Help Articles anytime, and you're definitely applicable. We'd love to take a closer look at what you understood or may have read that stated the alternative. Thanks!

title: Inaccurate carb count
body: Ever since the last update, entering 2 different recipes the app  is giving me higher carb count than the original recipe. I’m not doing substitutions . One recipe called for 2 servings  and I made 4, the other was 1 serving and divided for 2, it is really disappointing . Recipes were from  two different  websites.
response: Hi OprincessO - Thanks for that feedback. How far off were the carb counts? Something rounding can introduce slight discrepancies. We pride ourselves on the accuracy of our database, so if you're significant differences, we'd love to take a look! Please reach out to our friendly support team via Settings → Help & Support. Cheers!

title: It’s an Ok App
body: I’m new to the Keto diet and I find this app isn’t that easy when you have to manually enter all your food because the brands they have listed - their nutritional info isn’t correct. I also don’t like how it doesn’t subtract the calories you burn after a workout.  I’ll stick with MyFitnessPal App.
response: Hi, and thanks for your review! You can easily use the barcode reader to scan any food label- no need to enter every food manually! As far as the macros deductions from exercise- a simple setting turns that off. Please do reach out to our friendly and knowledgeable Support Team directly within the app or support@carbmanager.com, and they'll be please as punch to assist you! :-)

title: There is NO SUPPORT
body: I agree that this is the best carb management app until something goes wrong… then it’s worthless. I sent a message for help. She replied asking for more information - that took 4 days. So I sent the detailed information and 5 days have passed and no response. This is a premium subscription!
response: Hi there, thanks for your review! Please reach back out to ouer Support Team and reference your App Review Username, Slimchick47 and we will expedite your request.

response: Hi there - thanks for the feedback. We now have FAQs and a comprehensive knowledge base on the new app available at help.carbmanager.com which you may find helpful in navigating the new features. If you have any specific issues, reach out in-app via Settings → Help & Support. Thanks!

title: Nee version is awful
body: Find another app, the nutrition is always wrong now, and you can no longer sync your watches for exercise unless you pay. Will find another to use not worth the trouble any longer.
response: Hi there, thanks for the review! Syncing fitness devices has always been a Premium Feature. We work hard on the accuracy of our Food DB. It's true some branded/processed foods have been input by users, so if there are inaccuracies, you can always Report a Food Error or make Quick Edits to them. Just reach out in-app, & we can help share how as well as how to identify our NCCDB verified foods to make it easier for logging!

title: Buyer beware!!!
body: App is ok but when you go into your app manager they have no option on their app to cancel your subscription and of course it auto re-news. I’ve been trying to communicate with them on how to do this but getting no response. Lousy customer service.
response: Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts. Really sorry to hear that you found canceling to be a hassle. We've done everything that we can to make it as quick and easy as possible. All that's required to cancel is to go to Settings/Account Setting/Manage Subscription. If you need additional assistance from our fully staffed Support Team, please reach out to us at support@carbmanager.com and reference your app review username, and they will be happy to assist you with your cancelation.

response: Hi there - your recipes should all still be there under "My Foods" in the main food search window (green + button and fork/knife icon.) You can scroll for saved and custom foods, and recipes. If what you expect to see isn't there, reach out to support in-app via Settings → Help & Support to assist with troubleshooting.

Please make sure you're running the most recent version of iOS and have automatic app updates turned on to receive our most recent updates and fixes for best performance of the app. Feel free to reach out to Support in-app via Settings → Help & Support if you're experiencing any specific issues, and we can troubleshoot. title: Counts sugar alcohols
body: There may be a minor debate as to whether to count sugar alcohols or not, but the consensus seems to be, especially with erythritol, to not count them as carb’s. But this app doesn’t take that into consideration so you’re left with thinking you’ve had more carbs in the day than you’ve really had.
response: Hey ZeIX - Thanks for taking the time to share your thoughts. We don't tend to come down on one side or the other in these type of debates. We leave it up to the user as to how they'd like to do their tracking. You can toggle whether sugar alcohols count as carbs by selecting to track total carbs, net carbs, or diabetes carbs. Each one counts sugar alcohols differently. For further information, please search our KB for "sugar alcohols" or reach out to our support team at support@carbmanager.com

title: Their macros are WRONG!
body: The protein values listed for meat differ from every website I’ve checked- and I’ve checked at least a dozen prior to writing this review. The numbers are so far off- and so consistently- that I felt the need to write a review. If you don’t take my word for it, just take the time to see for yourself! Be careful.
response: Hello from Carb Manager support and thank you for your review. We're happy to investigate some recently logged items in your account to ensure that you are selecting the correct ingredients! We do pride ourselves on our databases being as accurate as possible! Please select "Need Help" in-app and reference the username "Threpus" so that we can assist you further. Looking forward to hearing from you shortly!

body: The feature I adored the most won’t work anymore. I tried disconnecting and then reconnecting but, nothing. And if I add additional steps, it doesn’t show calories burned. No longer useful as a tracker. So disappointed!
response: Hi there - thanks for the feedback, and sorry you're experiencing these issues. Garmin syncing has been a known issue that our development team are working on, and releasing app updates as soon as possible. If disconnecting and reconnecting hasn't worked yet, please try again. And feel free to reach out to Support in-app via Settings → Help & Support for personalized troubleshooting with this. Thanks!

If you're still experiencing issues, you can reach out to support in-app via Settings → Help & Support with your app store username and question.

We completely understand that change can be difficult! We had gotten a lot of feedback about how the old design felt dated. If you give it a chance, we're confident that you'll come to appreciate the new look and feel. Don't hesitate to reach out in the app via Settings → Help & Support w/ any specific questions!

response: Hi and thanks for your positive review. Our app adapts to nearly any diet, such as Keto, Vegan, Paleo, and Mediterranean, and our user base follows a multitude of these. You can even combine Mediterranean with Keto if you'd like, based on their principles. That said, message us in-app, and we can share how to adapt your account and filter for recipes/meal plans that suit your needs best. Thanks!

response: We are so sorry for the interruption! This will restore your data. If you need additional assistance, please email us at support@wombatapps.com.

body: I hate the updated version.  I was quite happy with the previous version and knew where everything was.  Is there a way to get this app back to its previous version for people who want that version?
response: Hi ferrets01 - Thanks for your feedback. Sorry to hear that you're not loving the new app! We've put a lot of time in since it was released fine tuning it based on customer feedback, and we'll continue to do so. With that being said, many users became very accustomed to the previous version, and we understand that change can be difficult! It's not possible to revert to the previous version; that version is being deprecated. Let us know if we can help with anything specific!

response: Hi, and thanks for your review! We work hard on the accuracy of our food database, however some branded & processed foods have been input by other users, so if you find there are inaccuracies, you can always Report a Food Error to be updated, and in the meantime, make Quick Edits to the Nutrients. Just reach out in-app, & we can share how. Thanks!

response: Hi! The pop-up to upgrade should only appear 1x a day or when trying to use Premium features. If you think it's happening more, please reach out in-app. We're happy to offer the free app to as many users as possible. However, we do rely on paid subscriptions to assist us in this goal. We hope that you understand and that you continue to enjoy!

title: Carb Manager compared to MyFitnessPal and Cronometer
body: I have used MyFitnessPal (premium version )For about four years. It is very easy to use and provides just about any information I could’ve ever wanted. My biggest complaint was inaccurate nutritional information on several occasions, but still they are pretty good. What really annoyed me recently was trying to find nutritional info for a common food. For some reason many of the foods in the category I was looking at were printed out in a foreign language (other than English). I had never had that problem before. I told look at Carb Manager and absolutely fell in love with it, having bought the premium version. I am prediabetic and over age 65. Carb manager very well fills my expectations for all types of information that anyone on a keto diet would like to know. Although MyFitnessPal Provided similar information, it wasn’t as focused on keto as carb manager is. I also bought the premium version of Cronometer. Chronometer reviews indicated they were the most accurate of all the nutrition apps, and what little experience I’ve had with it so far I find that to be true. However, extremely high accuracy for nutritional information Hass to be weighed against the quantitative inputs one makes - which is often an estimate. So the overall accuracy of nutritional information for me, was not enough to sell me. Chronometer also had no easy way to input water consumption. Bottom line is that carb manager for me, has the best combination of nutritional information, ease of input and some extremely well laid out navigation within the app.

Message us in-app & we can share how to distinguish our USDA-approved foods, or help with anything else. Thanks!

title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
body: Okay so I recently got engaged and like most people in a happy relationship I put on some happy weight after being together for 3 years. LOL. I knew that I wanted to lose about 20 pounds before our wedding but I  was CLUELESS on where to begin. I’ve never had a problem with my weight because I’ve always stayed so active, but in the past year I’ve been in nursing school and if you’ve been there, you feel my pain. Finding time to exercise, eat right, study, go to class, clinicals, etc. is TOUGH. So I heard all about the keto diet and figured I’d give it a try. Once again keep in mind I’m clueless about the whole process and I’m the type of person that doesn’t trust just ANY article/post I come across. So I did some research and came across the Carb Manager app and YALL..... it was a game changer. If you’re a beginner like me and don’t know what in the world you’re doing, THIS IS THE APP FOR YOU. Granted, to get the best results from it I do recommend paying for the subscription but it’s WELL worth it. This app literally gives you a TON of recipes, let’s you log which one you’re going to eat that day and makes a dang SHOPPING LIST for you! Does it get much better than that y’all? I think not. There is also a place where you can log your exercise and apply it to your daily intake and you can also keep track of how much water you drink. Mind blown. ALSO you can upload recipes you find on Pinterest etc. to make sure they’re legit (big plus for me because like I said I’m a skeptic about most things LOL) it literally breaks it down into a pie chart for you — and if you’re like me and have an occasional sweet tooth, fret not, because guess what? There’s plenty of dessert recipes too! It gives you all kinds of information about the diet and explains everything to a T. So yeah thanks for coming to my TED talk y’all. LOL...... But seriously though download the app. (:

title: Recipes Cost $40??

You can also visit carbmanager.com to browse the Premium recipes that are only available as a paid user in-app. We'll also be happy to show you what other free features are available to you. Please select "Need Help" in-app and reference the username "JFRaleigh" and we'll be happy to help!

title: I SOOO LOVE THIS APP❤️❤️
body: I’m so impressed with how user friendly this app is. I started the keto diet in November 2019 and I’ve lost 30 pounds. I started doing this by myself but when my husband would taste my food he wanted it instead of what I made for him. Needless to say, now we’re both doing it! He didn’t need to lose weight but he wanted to do it because it’s a much healthier way of eating and he wanted to support my journey with keto along the way.  At a Christmas party we have with our friends every year all my friends started asking me what I was doing. I asked what they meant because they know I can’t exercise due to a lot of bone, joint, and spinal health issues. They asked what I was doing to lose weight and what I was doing to my skin. I told them I was on the keto diet and what apps I use to help manage and keep me motivated. They were in awe. I had asked my best friend, who was hosting the party, a few days before the party to set a piece of beef roast aside for me before she added anything so I wouldn’t break my diet and that really peaked her interest. Since that night she has asked me a lot of questions about the diet so I’ve referred this app to her. Since I’m at home all day every day I know that it’s much easier for me to stay true to the diet than for those who work out of the home but trust me, it’s still very doable!  I love Lifesum!! I had the app an entire year before I ever used it. I guess I was ready mentally, but after 2 weeks my energy was higher than it had been in years, I lost weight and my skin is glowing! My hair stopped falling out and my nails stopped breaking as much!  If you’re thinking about doing keto I do HIGHLY recommend Lifesum!! You won’t be disappointed!!

title: Good BUT....
body: Some bugs--at times the screen for "go premium" pops up though I'm already premium and so I have to reload pages. Also, often times I can’t generate a meal plan. Very buggy there. I wish there was a feature for duplicating whole days worth of food for future dates in meal planner at one time, and that you could designate more than one day to copy foods at a time. I don't like literally having to plan meals out one day at a time when I know exactly what I'll be eating for the whole week consists of the same meals prepped for 7 days or more. Also, there is an issue with converting URL recipes, like those from my Pinterest boards, to this app. Since I enjoy dairy free and nearly zero carb meals, in app recipes are very limited for me so this is a feature that I wish were to work more smoothly. Other than that, this app is very intuitive and user friendly programming though, and I love that I can track my insulin doses and blood sugar levels on this as well as ketone levels daily to see how many carbs a day keeps me in or kicks me out of nutritional ketosis. I wish there were more meat free options of recipes for keto dieting, but I love the shopping list action. Though it will add on multiples of the same item in various quantities, it is easy to navigate through while at the store since those items are paired together. So if I see that there is about 60 tbsp of olive oil that I need in one week, then I will make sure to get about 4 cups worth of olive oil for that week or about 32 oz. it takes a little brain math but maybe that's something they will do for members automatically as the app evolves. I would rate it about a 3.5 so I rounded my rating up to 4 stars. I hope my review helped answer some common questions. :)

title: Almost perfect
body: I have been trying out two diet apps back to back and find Carb Manager easier to use. You can track not only your weight but measurements and ketones and supplements. The only downside is putting in vitamins is a pain. There should be a way to switch to percentages or IU, but it is stuck in mg/mcg which makes me end up spending way too much time to figure out how much I am getting. The other app I use is all percentages which makes entering custom food quick and easy. The other thing I actually HATE is if you go over your carbs for the day (I had 4 cups of Broccoli for dinner so yeah) your bar/meter goes completely red and makes you feel as if you messed up. They need to get rid of that because I feel as if I am being punished for going say 1 or 2 carbs over my macro amount. I can understand if you went say 40 carbs over then yeah maybe but the red carb meter is too off putting. The app should be rewarding, not punishing. It is easier to look up foods but a lot in the system had nutrition all wrong so I am spending more time entering my food. I don’t see myself sticking with this app unless a few things are changed. I much prefer the other app as it rewards you plus was $10 cheaper for premium. Still I like this app but those few things take up too much time or aggravate me.
response: Hi there, thanks for the great feedback. Please check Settings > Vitamin D Units for the option to change to IUs from mcgs. There is also an option to have the progress bar turn orange instead of red if you are less than 15% over your carbs goal. Thanks again for using Carb Manager!

title: Soooooo....
body: I’ve used Lose It several times to log food over the years, most recently, a 450 day streak. Although I’ve only used this app for 24 hours there are a couple of key differences that make it better if you’re doing KETO. (1) ability to choose your own macros easily and then how it presents them in the daily log. It just works better. (2) How recipes are presented in premium versions are better with CM. (3) The “insights” in lose it were exciting, but they weren’t useful. I think CM has more useful info and less hype. (4) everything else you’d expect in a modern day high end food app is there... and then some. Easy food logging, big database, details out the kazoo etc.

title: Decent tracker but a bit inaccurate
body: I’ve been using this for over a year now. It’s not terrible but I’m finding a lot of inaccuracies in their food database. Scanned foods are often returned at higher calories and carbs than what’s in the package and I’ve noticed numerous times when quite a few members have reported the inaccuracies and the foods are never corrected. It makes it a bit more tedious to log food as you can’t trust the scan option and you end up having to manually enter all the nutritional info.

body: I used to really love this app. Yes it was clunky and there were quite a few menus to explore, but in the end you could do just about everything you wanted to and a few things you didn’t even know you wanted to!

Any other issues or questions please reach out directly to our Support Team within the app or at support@carbmanager.com. Thanks!

title: WARNING COUNTS R OFF!! DEVELOPERS PLEASE READ!!
body: I’ve been tracking my macros for keto for a week now! The macro amounts on many foods are WRONG!!! Check your packages for a serving size and how many carbs, fats, and calories. I found many foods I use daily are incorrect!! For example, a cheese I eat is calculating an extra carb, an extra fat and an extra calorie, sometimes and extra protein! This is crucial for for me because I just started keto and I can’t go over my macros. So one dinner night, my macro counts for my entire meal we’re 4 or 5 grams over in all 4 of these areas! What upsets me is, I just caught this yesterday, which means for days my macros were way off. I’ve tried to report this in app, it won’t work. So if your going to use this app, double check your macros, which can be done via internet, or packaging!
response: Hi there! Please contact us directly at support@wombatapps.com (ask for Kevin) so we can take a look at your settings and help get them fixed. Thanks!

title: Good

title: Love it

title: Review of CM
body: I ❤️ CM 🔥💯

title: Love Carb Manager
body: I think this app is fabulous!  It's everything I wanted. Had to contact Customer Service because I was having trouble signing in but they got back to me in less than 24 hours with a resolution. I purchased the premium app and I'm glad I did. I used the non-premium for awhile but wanted the extras in premium.  There are a couple things I noticed that I hope they "catch up" on. As mentioned by another reviewer the search feature does not present an alphabetized list and sometimes I have to switch around word order to find. However, once you put foods in your favorites they are alphabetized. In addition, the water feature is only in 8 oz increments. As I often drink 1/2 cups or 12 oz they should really change this to an ounce feature, or at least tap twice on the glass. Once for 4 oz twice for 8 oz. minor details. PC sync is also very nice. I really like the analyze feature and supplements categories although my supplements don't come up in bar scan and I had to put them in as custom foods. Bar scan is great feature. It's found things I could not find on the search feature right away. Search feature also has numerous quantity selections to choose from so however I measure foods or decide on portions I've never had trouble finding (although sometimes I need to squint to see what the portion size says if it's a really long description).

title: Fantastic!
body: I have lost 122 lbs with about 65 lbs to go now. I've used Richard Simmons, weight watchers, overeaters anonymous, Jenny Craig,and hypnosis.  Three years ago I was diagnosed with type two diabetes as so many of us Americans now are. I have successfully counted weight watchers points and calories but the ketogenic diet seems to truly be a key piece to my weight-loss puzzle/diabetic management. Both my doctor who is a diabetic specialist and my nutritionist have confirmed that a ketogenic diet is extremely beneficial for type two diabetic patients. But the reality of daily life makes logging grams of carbohydrates a real barrier to staying accountable. Carb Manager is a fantastic app that makes accurately tracking carbohydrate intake as painless and convenient as is probably possible to achieve. I especially like the barcode reader which allows me to get the exact product carbohydrates. I've been using CM now for about two months with great success. Like all of these things YOU have to make time to do it every day. But really it just takes a couple of minutes to log your food. Tracking weight and body size is also super convenient. It's just a great health and nutrition management app. I highly recommend it!
response: Hi Pradis, wow! Way to go! That absolutely makes our day to hear about amazing, life changing success, and we're delighted that Carb Manager was able to help you along the way. It's really our goal to make carb tracking / diet management as quick and easy as possible. Please check out our latest version and let us know what you think, and keep us posted on your progress. Best wishes from the Carb Manager team!

title: Meh
body: Meh

title: Beware: HORRIBLY.  S L OW slower slowest
response: Hi KetoPerson - It looks like you're still on version 7.0.0 of the app. We've pushed some incremental updates that should resolve any lag issues. Please update both the app and your iOS version; that should resolve the issue! If the app is still slow at that point, don't hesitate to reach out to our team in the app via Settings → Help & Support. Cheers!

response: Hey there, and thanks for the review! If you have any specific questions or concerns, feel free to reach out in-app. Thanks!

title: I HATE THIS APP

response: Hi there, and thanks for your review. If your Macros seem way off or too low, there's most likely a wrong setting or input in your Profile. Please message us in-app, by selecting Settings-"Need help?", so we can check out your account. Thanks!

title: This is not free
body: This is not free
response: Hi Rusty - Thanks for reaching out. Our core app is free and always will be. Hundreds of thousands of users have reached their fitness goals by using just the free version of the app. If you're having trouble accessing the free app, please reach out to our support team at support@carbmanager.com and they'll be more than happy to assist!

title: Search needs refining
body: Overall I like this app a lot. If you don't eat a lot of pre-packaged food, it's fairly easy to use. However, the search function is frustrating; what should be a simple search becomes a few minutes of scrolling and reading. A search for half & half turns up at least a hundred items unrelated to half & half. Search for Half AND half and you'll find it. Search for "hamburger," a low-carb mainstay, and you have to scroll through countless variations, "w/ pickles in bun," w/ pickles and onion on bun," "McDonalds with ketchup and pickles on bun." honestly. How many low-carbers are eating buns and McDonald's burgers... I don't want to scroll through this to get to plain ol hamburger. Also, another example, good luck finding sugar free jello on it, but you can find all manner of regular sugar filled jello. In a low carb app. I ask you! The other issue I do have is that in each individual day's screen, my net carb count is accurate, but in my main screen on the calendar portion my net carbs show me as being way over my 20g goal which is annoying. Overall I like it but the search kills me and the inaccurate carb count in the calendar page annoys me.

title: Awesome App
body: Really like this app. It was everything for nutrition that my FitBit app is not. Love the breakdown in carbs, fiber, protein, fat, and macro nutrients. A friend of mine introduced me to carb manager, and even in the short time I have been using it, I have already begun cutting pounds. I exercise a lot, and have had trouble cutting the fat. Diet and rest are the keys to success, and this app has given me the tools to succeed. Barcode scanner works really well. You can create custom foods to enter in supplements. Lots of charts and info. My only drawback is that there is not seamless integration with Fitbit. You have to download another app to export data from Fitbit to Apple Health in order to get your data, but even then, Fitbit is holding up key elements from heart rate and active calories. This is on Fitbit though. They need to play nice. I like my Fitbit, but this makes me want to move over to an apple watch. My wife has one, and there is seamless integration across all apps. Carb Manager is fantastic. Have been pushing it on all my friends. Not just a carb manager. Manage it all.

title: Need to be food detective
body: The display, intent, and exhaustive list of foods on this app are very good. However, actually tracking food is cumbersome. You have to find the right area to find the food: packaged or common foods. Then go to the right category, and scroll through some more.I tried to track scrambled eggs--plain scrambled eggs--and couldn't find it. There were all sorts of other scrambled eggs in the mix search mix, and other types of plain eggs that I had to scroll past in the common foods area, but no plain scrambled eggs. Then I tried to track a piece of red pepper. Again, lots of scrolling through foods/sections to find the right one. Still didn't find what I was looking for and gave up. You have to do a lot of searching for the foods you want to track. Too much work for me. I've gone back to using the MyNetDiary app. What would help this app is to make it easier to find and track the foods you do eat. The MyNetDiary app lets you put the food in the search area and find what you're eating immediately. Regular foods seem to pop up more often. Then, when you use it again it remembers your top foods. Would love to see this app do the same thing. (Downside of MyNetDiary is that it doesn't easily conform to low carb diets and constantly tells you your food balance is out of whack).  This app may work for more patient folks, but wasn't helpful for me.
response: Hi there. Thanks for the note -- it's been ranked one of the most helpful, and we appreciate the feedback. The reason we're writing back now (about a year after you first posted) is that recently made some major improvements to food search, and would love for you to give the app another look. Now, search is super fast, accurate, and comprehensive. For example, type "scrambled eggs" and exactly that, with an image, will appear. You can find your most commonly eaten foods under Quick Find -> Favorites / Frequent / Recent. Please contact us if you'd like us to walk you through the new app or if you'd like to try out the Premium features. All the best, Team CM. UPDATE: We just licensed over 500,000 foods from the MyNetDiary database. Check it out!

title: Sugar Alcohols N/A
body: I bought this program to help me easily count my net carbs. I love the fact that you can scan an item in since I use bars often, like the extend bar, kind bar, or think thins, etc...I was very surprised to find out that extend nutrition says their bar has 1 g net carb and this app says they have 18 g net carbs. I looked at the information tab and found out that sugar alcohols were listed as N/A and would not let me edit that. Regardless the whole point of using the scanner was that the information would be transferred from the product exactly the way the product had listed it. This app decides to not allow sugar alcohols unless you do a custom food product and make it yourself. I don't mind doing this but the only reason I bought the program in the first place was so I wouldn't have to do this. Just scan and go is what I was looking for. I tried to get customer service and no one has responded. I guess I'm stuck with this product but I probably won't use it much and don't really recommend it if this is what you wanted to use it for or if you're counting your net carbs.
response: Hi there, we just wanted to let you know that we've added hundreds of thousands of verified foods, and our foods now include sugar alcohols info. We would love for you to check it out and considering giving Carb Manager another chance! All the best, Team CM.

title: Do NOT upgrade to Premium!!!
body: First, KUDOS to the developers of the free Carb Manager app. It's pretty good, I do like how many foods are in their database, it seems accurate and it HAS kept me accountable. Using it, I have lost weight using it. Really good.
response: Hi Cabradle, thanks for contacting us. We're glad you like the app, and appreciate your feedback on the Premium upgrade. To clarify, Premium includes the following features: full web access and automatic syncing; unlimited voice, natural language and photo AI logging; an e-book and other info; fitness device integration; printable diet reports and analysis; charts & graphs for dozens of nutrients and health metrics; and low carb recipes. The $40 annual fee is similar or less than similar upgrades on many other health apps. We'd love for you to contact us directly at support@wombatapps.com to discuss your experience with Premium and how we can help make you happy!

title: Best app to manage daily carb intake
body: I credit this app for assisting me in losing over 30 lbs and cutting my body fat from 34% to 21% after using for 10 months. Of course I also worked out but previously had little progress in dropping weight. Once I used this app to manage my daily carb and calories intake I started dropping weight. I feel energized and my appetite has greatly decreased as a result of stabilizing my insulin levels due to proper carb management. I don't eliminate carbs just minimize. Also allows me to still eat things I have a hankering for throughout the day but in smaller portions or choosing alternatives that are lower in carbs. Helps me to be flexible with a dynamic diet as opposed to a static diet. I'm 49 years old and was amazed that my metabolism can almost function at a 20 yr old level when properly managing carb intake. Can't live without this app. I'm still making progress and now have a target of 15% body fat. I'm leaner and have decent muscle definition as a result. Everyone thinks I'm in my mid 30's. Not bad for a soon to be a 50 year old man.
response: Hi Charlie, wow! Congratulations on you fantastic success with your low carb diet. There are so many benefits to going low carb, and I think that its advantages over the low calorie approach are finally becoming widely known. I'm really glad that Carb Manager has been helpful to you in progressing toward your goals. Please keep in touch and let us know when you get to 15%! And do check out our latest version and send your feedback. Best wishes!

title: Time to drop this app...
body: I'll go back to pencil and paper before I will struggle with this another hour. Was concerned as I watched it auto update this morning. Tried it and was very disappointed. Why does everything need rings just because Apple Watch has it??? I got rid of the rings and got a completely meaningless pie chart as I had only entered 1 item for the day. Tried editing my last item from last night as planned and it was a nightmare. The simple wheel of portions and measurement are gone. I hate tapping +++ vs ---.  The user interface is blurry. I actually saw 1-1/2 in font that was barely readable. Additional analysis charts  are there but I am not 'anal' and they are hard to read. Plus you do not know my goals and my goals are none of your business. But as I played with them, it is not easy,  not intuitive, and presumes too much on the part of the app. All I want is a count of carb, fat and protein. Period.
response: Hi Al, we appreciate your input and hope you will consider giving the new version another chance. We've increased font sizes, and fixed a few bugs. For the food picker, you can now use the + and - buttons to change the value, or just tap on the field and enter a value with the keypad. Try it out for a while and let us know where we can improve. We really do listen to feedback and make changes based on what users want.

title: Latest Update is Great!
body: The updated Carb Manager App has added more features that make it even more user friendly. I like the new recipe database, it allows you to search over 360,000 recipes while using the app. If you feel stuck in your meal options, simply search for new ones and the app will save them for you and figures the carbs, calories, etc. This is a great option! There are also more analysis reports available with a breakdown of the vitamins and nutrients you are or are not getting from the foods you eat, which I find helpful. As well as water intake and exercise, the amount of sleep you get a night is also featured on the app. I like this addition and think it helps with my overall health. The Carb Manager app is a great tool for a busy lifestyle, not only for low carb eating but for charting one's health. I highly recommend this app to anyone wanting to be more aware of what they are eating.

title: Powerful but awkward
body: The app is great at tracking nutrient and carbs. However the interface is confusing and editing meals/food items is arrived from various places with different effects. Sometimes editing a nutrient value doesn't change it. Pictures come out sideways or not at all. Taking a picture of a meal as you are about to eat it requires creating a meal first and then adding the picture (granted you can go back and add ingredients later but it's not clear how to do that.) Perhaps a bit more time with app will help wire my brain to its interface design choices, but in the meantime I'm tapping around to figure how to edit things or making my daily adding of things more efficient.

title: When it works ...
body: When this app works it's great and inputs are easy, but it seems like if you are not on WiFii it rarely works so I have to remember to add things when I get back on WiFii and about 3-4 times per week, even on WiFii it's not working so I have to add things when I can finally get it to respond.  During these times, I am able to see the foods I have saved in my 'favorites' but when I click to add it does not allow me to add them.  I have checked my WiFii connections and turned off WiFii to see if this makes a difference - to no avail.  Seems like this is a bug that the developer needs to fix.  The only other complaint is that if I eat out you cannot access very many particular foods at specific restaurants,  many of the other apps let you access complete restaurant menu's that you can search but this app seems to have very little menu access for common restaurants.  While this is not as big an issue as the other 2 it can make this app a little less convenient to utilize.

title: Great Atkins counter!
body: I just purchased this app today and played around with it for a couple hours and this works great despite some bad reviews. The database is vast but you need to learn how to use the search engine. May be the Foods By Category could be broken down a little better.

title: Search is main weakness
body: Very nice app overall. Seems to be well organized and thought out in most details except for the search function. First, unlike most modern searches there is no type ahead feature. Secondly and more annoying to me is that the search is done in an 'or' sense rather than 'and'. By that I mean that if you were searching for 'caesar salad dressing' and typed in all those words you would get matches off of each word. So rather than narrowing your search it actually returns more results.

title: Useless. Missing lots of natural foods.
body: After reading the reviews for the old version, I was hoping the new version would be better so I bought it. What a waste of money. If you are already on a whole food diet, don't expect to find many food items here. Lots of natural cheeses are missing, there isn't a red potato or other variety other than white unless it's a deep fried chip. Milk is limited, couldn't find coconut milk or almond milk or any other alternates either, but they do have every kind of processed cow and infant formula. You can find almost any processed or fast food on here. In order to find the few raw items, you have to scroll through HUNDREDS of processed food items. There are lots of greens added, however. I would like to see more menus with unprocessed, non-packaged food items separated from the rest. I've just spent a  little more than a hour sorting through it, and only found about a dozen foods to add to my favorites. This is useless as it doesn't have lots of the food I eat. You are better off researching your food items on the internet and tracking the carbs in a notebook.

title: Fantastic, better than $50 programs
body: Just what the paleo doctor ordered. A very similar program paleo tracker goes for $1 per week. Can't beat carb tracker. However, the graphs don't have a vertical axis. You can certainly see the trends, but have to touch each data point to see what it is. Also regarding tracking your weight, there's no way to set the date range, so when you look at the graph it goes from the beginning and you have to scroll for years just to see how you did over the last month. Nevertheless, this is the best carb or paleo tracker out there. I wish there was a way to get averages over a user-defined period (like the past month). Your only choice is to look at a graph and guess.  I wish you could edit dates weights were taken. I made a mistake and there is no way to change date

title: Good and bad
body: The good: keeps good track of carbs, plus calories, fat, fiber, etc.  The charts are nice. I like the pie chart and that the overview tells what percentage of your carb goal you've had that day.

title: Can't live without this app!
body: I have used this app daily for over 4 months and have never experienced any issues (until the most recent update-but those were taken care of super fast with the awesome support of this team!). This app is easy, intuitive, and quick. I am just getting used to the new format since the most recent update so I haven't decided which I like better (old or new) but I do like some of the added features (adding a note, being able to add to a previous day something you may have forgotten or in my case, fell asleep before it was added) so I'm thinking this new layout will be awesome once I get used to it. I can't say enough how appreciative I am of the quick response I got from the support team as I literally can't go without this app since I started my ketogenic diet 4 months ago. I know there are other apps out there but this one's the best!

title: Yeah, it's back!
body: I was using the app every day and one day it disappeared! I downloaded many other trackers and was not happy with them at all. I am so happy this app is back! I would pay for this app to help make sure development dollars are available to make it even better.

title: Fair carb counter !! JUNE '16 update great !!
body: SEPT. 2016 UPDATE

title: Love the app
body: I started using this to actively watch how many carbs I was eating instead of guesswork. As as diabetic it has made a huge difference in my numbers. Seeing the carb totals and adding them up throughout the day really helps to make better choices. My blood sugar has gone down 10 points, and only within a few  weeks! I have to add that along with this app I also purchased a Fitbit and together they have worked miracles. They go hand in hand perfectly.

title: Great app, even after the update
body: Update is not as intuitive as I'd like, but I was able to do everything I needed. I'm still giving it 5 stars because the developers are in the process of fixing the bugs. Here's my pros and not so pro about the update:
response: Hi Linda, thanks again for the feedback! We're working overtime to make this update perfect, and really appreciate your input.

title: Beautifully designed app continues to evolve
body: I'm not a diabetic, so I am not interested in a complex app to track insulin and blood sugar. Carb manager is great for tracking nutrition and weight in a simple, well-designed interface. It keeps an easy to use ongoing log so that you can keep track of net carbs, very helpful for those of us following the Atkins plan, as well as other nutritional variables. There is a fine visual display that gives you a quick sense of the day's nutrition, a very comprehensive database of foods, and a weekly  graphing function. The developer is very responsive to suggestions, sometimes turning around updates virtually overnight. The app continues to improve with each update. Highly recommended.

title: Almost five stars
body: I love this app. I have tried several others, found several that I have to sit at my computer that are just as good, but I wanted something that I could use with my iphone and iPad. This app is it! I am on Atkins and it helps me count my net carbs while other apps only count carbs.

title: Great, and extremely helpful App
body: I have been on the low carb living for over six years. I started off at 280lbs, now I'm 173, and 5'8. I wanted to drop more so I went back into weight loss mode. I lost 20 lbs, and stayed there for two months. Then I got this app and it has been amazing!! I have dropped another five lbs! It's not hard to see myself on a size seven, started as a size twenty four,I'm  a ten now :-)  It's super easy to use, shows all your Nutrition values, vitamins, and more!! I can also add items when I can't find them, along with adding  all the specs. Without this App I seriously don't think I could have figured out how to drop my last thirty pounds, thank you for this wonderful App!!!

title: Love this app
body: I love this app. I have list over 60 lbs and am now on phase 3 of the Ideal Protein diet. This app has been a great tool that I presently use every day. Each feature is a great help enabling me to see my progress with my weight and now my maintaining it.

title: Some limitations - but overall really great
body: This is a smart, simple app that's easy to use. It adds partial carbs into your daily total, so you don't end up with lots of uncounted fractions. It doesn't have much a database of branded foods -- just foods themselves -- so you don't have to sift through a list (as on WW or Atkins) that's basically a commercial. You can search using just a few letters. On the down side, carb counts in the app don't always match counts on packaging. There's no way to mark favorites, so you always have to re-find foods. A lot of low-carb vegetarian staples are not listed (why not unsweetened soy milk?) But as a decent, easily adaptable, free app that's not tied to a giant corporation trying to profit off of yo-yo dieters, it gets all the love.

title: I am replacing my 1 star with 5 stars!!
body: I could not get the barcode camera to work after I upgraded to the premium plan that this app has to offer, and it was my ignorance that was keeping me from using the app to it fullest potential.

title: Just what I was looking for!!
body: This is a great little app, once you get used to using the different features. The search feature is not exactly alphabetical so you do have to adjust your search by learning how they categorize there food groups. However, there's a great little custom tool to add your favorite foods or recipes, as well as a scan button to scan in packaged foods. Total carbs, plus net carbs, as well as total calories and protein, track everything you need. It also allows you to set your goals for each of these macros. And you can track your exercise calorie burn. So helpful for low-carb high-fat diet!! It also will allow you to track other nutrients if you desire. Worth it!!!

title: Great tool for obtaining weight loss goal
body: I use this app all throughout the day to manage my diet and track my exercise. I can instantly check net carbs and calories of food.  Tracking consumption is also very easy. I will give it 5 stars when they 1) also remove alcohol surgars from net carbs, 2) when you are adding foods you have eaten during the day list other foods that you normally eat with those foods so you can more quickly update your tracker and 3) modify the software to update directly with Fibit to bring in walking etc.  I think they were doing this with their failed update.  It is still a great app that has become a vital part of my life in helping keep my healthy lifestyle on track.

title: Great App but I wish it did this.....
body: I am so glad I came across this app. It has helped me tremendously in figuring out my keto diet. It automatically gives me the % of carbs (net AND total! Yay!) proteins and fats. I appreciate the "scan barcode" feature as it makes logging packaged foods so easy. The only thing that is missing for me is the ability to log your own recipe and have it figure out the percentages per serving size. That would be incredibly helpful. I believe you have to pay for the yearly subscription for that feature. Even my free calorie counter app gave that option. Otherwise, this has been wonderful in helping me keep track of my food, water and exercise.

title: Very Helpful but ...
body: There are a few small things could be improved:  when you are searching for more than one food, you can click in the search bar and backspace/delete the last item you searched for, Which is time consuming and aggravating, but if you "X" out of the last item, it takes you out of the search field all together so you have to click back in the search bar. When searching for one food, neither is a problem, but when searching for multiple items, it gets old really quickly. And I have to say that I prefer the previous version much more.

title: Concept is good -  But search Poor
body: The concept of this app is very good and the visual display of the graphs is clear and easy to understand..  HOWEVER - the search process really puts this app significantly behind competitors.  Searching for something simple like "cheese" doesn't bring you to the most basic listing from which to find the cheese you're looking for.  You have to scroll and scroll through seemingly endless, often completely unrelated entries before you can find something that resembles the basic term you were searching for.   More complex searches are even more fraught with unrelated items.   If they can develop a better search feature, I may reinstall it.  But for now, I cannot recommend this app.  There are others in the app store that do this much better.

title: Helpful for Primal Eating
body: I've now been using the app for two weeks.  I'm eating a Primal diet and am trying hard to make sure my diet is nutritionally complete.  I love the macronutrient features, the graphs help me know what I need to be supplementing, and the number of REAL foods in the database is comprehensive.

title: Very helpful!
body: As a beginner to the low carb lifestyle, I was looking for an app to help me to account for & take charge of what I was eating. This app has helped me to do so. Keeping a journal here is much easier than pen & paper charting. I have used the custom foods tab a lot to input the specific brands & amounts. Having a way to input sugar alcohols would be nice. I work around this by including these in the fiber when setting up custom foods such as Atkins products. There seems to be repetition in the database of foods. Also, I'm not sure what NS means. Setting up a custom food when in doubt takes care of these issues. Thanks for helping me keep track of my food intake!

title: Good but could be better; may I suggest?
body: [UPDATED…] Also need a way to account for the positive effects of exercise; currently I have to use the Lose It app to know the values, but have no way to incorporate them into Carb Counter.

title: Perfect companion for shedding pounds the right way
body: After reading Gary Taubes' "Why We Get Fat: And What to do About it" I now know the biological and scientific reasons behind getting fat and losing it. It's carbs people! It's not about calories or exercise. It all about carbs.

title: Overall good app but not that user friendly
body: I am new to the ketogenic diet so this app has been a very easy way to track my net carbs. It's a hassle switching between all the screens to log food and then see what your daily overview is after you entered something. So I paid for the sync ability to use it on my desktop thinking that if I was planning my day of eating it would be easier there and then I could do small changes on the app itself. Wrong! The desktop version is just as frustrating! Clicking from page to page to search and enter foods, then switch again for the overview. Wish they would streamline the page bc otherwise it's a good app.

title: Great Tool for Counting Carbs
body: I've been using the app to log everything I'm doing on the Atkins plan.  It's very simple to navigate the app.  The food database is decent and it's very easy to add a food to the database if necessary.  Also tracking exercise and things like weight and body measurements are very basic as well.  The only thing I would question would be some of the exercise database's calories-burned estimates.  For example, I do Tai Chi.  The exercise database says that 30 minutes of Tai Chi burns 254 calories. With the slow movements of Tai Chi, I find that to possibly be wrong.  Other than than that, this app is a great addition to anyone's arsenal of healthy living trackers.

title: Perfect for ketogenic or other low-carb diets
body: I love this! It's intuitive especially if you've used other food trackers like MFP in the past. Unfortunately, MFP doesn't track net carbs so I went looking for something else.

title: Loved this app until latest update
body: The new interface is so confusing. The buttons don't make sense when editing recipes. Every time I try to change a setting, the wheel turns but then it goes back to the same screen. They added a progress circle which is almost impossible to see at a glance what your macros are. It would be so much better to have a progress bar for each macro like they do for net carbs. I would rather see at a glance horizontal colored bars instead of a confusing circle where it's impossible to tell percentages around a circle.
response: Hi Diana, we had a server outage yesterday that was causing some loading problems, but it has since been resolved. FYI, you can switch back to the progress bar by going to Settings -> Progress Wheel and turn it off there.

title: New version/revision/upgrade etc.
body: Impossible to use. Spent 45 minutes trying to add a food item to an established (paid for) account. Couldn't do it. Sent feedback. No acknowledgment. So annoying that I'm deleting the app as of this evening. For this, they want to attach a monthly fee? Not likely. Keep it!
response: Hi there, sorry for the problem! We had a server outage, but all is now working. Please give it another whirl.

title: Ok but needs more development
body: Meets most of my needs. Keeps me on track. GOOD: nice database, can create favorites, nutrition info helpful. NEEDS: 1.ability to make changes to favorite and custom entries after saving. Now, you have to delete the whole entry and start over!  2.  Pie chart often not accurate based on food shown. 3. Get rid of duplicate entries in database.  4.  Add sugar alcohol option in nutrition data entry so that net carb count is correct when entering Atkins foods. Right now, the formula they use totally screws up the carb count for any food with sugar alcohols.  5. Add easy to find suggestion contact for developers. 6.  Guys, answer your messages. I sent one 2 weeks ago and have heard nothing!

title: Good but please improve
body: I like this app. I like that the emphasis is really on carbs-- not calories. I like the daily totals charts. It is a useful app but it could be better. When you update please consider 1. Improving the food search. It works about half the time. 2. Most people eat the exact same meal at least at breakfast. Please add a "save meal " search so we can enter a whole meal at once. ( look at Lose It.  Not a good carb app at all but their meal save is well done and even let's you edit) 3. Probably about a third of the scans I run are not successful and they are not on weird foods. But thank you for this useful app.

title: A bit disappointed
body: I love the app but there are glitches that need to be addressed to make it a great app. The scanner has only worked for me once and it was a common food that is sold everywhere. It isn't user friendly as is My Fitness Pal that I've been using but it has glitches as well. I find it hard to believe that when you purchase a bundle and only one or two of them work well. I doubt that my paying an extra yearly fee will improve things. It is, however, less costly than the $9.99 monthly fee that My Fitness Pal charges. I would gladly give it a 5 star rating but I need to experience a few more improvements to the app.

title: Awesome Tracker
body: I've been doing a LCHF diet for a while now but had a difficult time tracking my daily foods. It was hard for me to know if I was going over my carb limit. This program is great as it helps me stay on track and helps keep me accountable for the day. I'm still new to this but I'm finding it's much easier knowing how many carbs I've used and what I have left. If you're doing a low carb diet, this program will give you the extra help needed to be successful in your weight loss!  Super easy to use....I would highly recommend this app!!

title: Easy to start using.
body: I have only used this for one day, putting off for weeks getting started.  The start was amazingly easy.  The information highlighted about some of our eating habits were amazing.  My husband, severe diabetic, and I are both using it although it was my husband's needs that made us start this.  He was amazingly open (you would have to know him to understand how amazing) to the new information that were highlighted as where exactly his eating habits were in great need of improvement.

title: Love this app!
body: I just started the Atkins diet 3 weeks ago, and this app has really helped me track everything from my daily food intake, water, measurements, etc...  it is so easy to use and I love the charts and graphs that show my progress over time. It also has a significant number of food options to search and find the nutrients, including packaged and restaurant options. I upgraded to the Premium version and it was well worth the money! I am down 12 lbs so far and attribute much of my success to using this app. Thanks!!!

title: Why ruin a perfect app with a ridiculous update with so many changes!!
body: As a diabetic I think this was a fantastic app for low carb dieting. The simplicity of the app made life so much easier.. the custom food section was great for snacks as well as beverages.. Reading a lot of the reviews I see users experience certain issues with bar codes. Whenever possible enter a food manually and it will ensure accurate carb counts.

title: Seems OK if you can afford it or want something simple
body: So, after you buy the app, to really get into doing the stuff you want with it  you will pay a $40 per your subscription.

title: Newbie--Still Learning
body: I've only had the app for a few days. There are a few big things that I'd love to see in a future update:

title: Rip Off
body: Just paid to get the app, tried to add my information including exercises and it would not work. I'm a little annoyed because I was not expecting that after reading all the reviews.

title: Skip this time consuming App
body: I gave this app a 90 day trail. It fails the test.

title: Useful adjunct to a low carb diet
body: Overall, I'm pleased and impressed with this app.  It's been stable for me--no crashes--and has many useful features--I'm impressed with the detailed nutritional info, the graphing, and the daily logs that allow you to analyze several factors.

title: Not a bad start but missing a lot of features
body: Like the focus on carb intake but database is missing 80% of what I'd typically buy, make, or eat and I have to manually enter everything (first time only). Many other apps allow you to scan a new food using smartphone.

title: Good App
body: I bought this app to keep track of my carbs and the extra features were a bonus.  Like anything else, there is a learning curve.  It does take some time to find certain foods, but you can always input the information and create custom foods that you tend to eat a lot...and then find them in the "recently viewed" foods when you need them again.

title: Love it
body: This app is easy to use and includes almost everything you'd need. Love the pie chart style macros diagram, LOVE the barcode scanner, and hat you can subtract daily exercise calories. I think it's very user friendly as is, though I can see some small improvements making it perfect (it would be great if the 'quick add' function included fats and proteins as well as carbs. I normally hate using trackers like these and will generally stop after a few days due to general annoyance, but I've used this one every day without fail for six weeks now and no sign of stopping.

title: Original Version Good for me.
body: The original version was great for keeping up with carbs but then they tried some crazy update that crashed & burned.  This app was WAY TO EXPENSIVE in the first place but I bit the bullet cuz I wanted the scanner option.

title: GREAT APP-TRACK MOST ANYTHIG
body: I've been using this app off and on for a year.  What I've realized is when I track I lose weight.  I like that you can track by carbs or calories, whatever works for you. Plus you can track so many other things including measurements. I've found the search very beneficial.  I love being able to scan something new and add it to list for future use. I use it while I'm shopping to scan item, see if I really want to use my carbs on that item. Great app and will continue using.

title: GREAT APP for low carb management
body: Just got this today and bought the upgrade. Love that I can track measurements and love the watch app. I did want to comment that it is very easy to find simple things like eggs and chicken. Another commenter said it isn't and that almost prevented me from getting the app. But I ate almost not packaged foods today and had no trouble finding plain ingredients. Also scanned a barcode and the food came up quickly. The green color at the top is a bit garish, but otherwise I'm loving this app.

title: Finally an app we deserve!
body: I was sick and tired of bad food tracking apps. We've all tried the Atkins app and it's terrible. MFP doesn't cater to low carb (but they can for $10 a month). I bought this app and I haven't looked back. It's fantastic. The barcode scanner is the best I've used. Entering food is easy and doesn't take long at all and is very precise with the various serving sizes (I weigh my food out and go by grams). I love looking at my macros and knowing that's EXACTLY what I've consumed today. I recommend this app to every low carb/keto person I know.

title: I like older version better.
body: I am learning this new version but I do like the older version better. My macro percentages were automatically on the pie chart without having to click on anything and I could see what I had remaining as far as calories etc. I can't get the badge to show my remaining carbs on my home screen and I hate that. I loved being able to know that in a glance without having to open the app. I'll continue to use it because I've been so successful with logging but it's definitely not as user friendly as the previous version.

title: Helpful but buggy
body: Definitely a helpful app, but discovering several oddities as I use it.

title: Kla0415
body: Once you learn the basics, very good.

title: Great App!
body: This app has been very useful for me as I try to follow a low carb diet. I am able to find out all the necessary nutrition information for the food I eat or want to eat. The graphing feature gives me a good idea as to how I am doing at maintaining my goals. I would like to see the ability to have a read out of my fat consumption and protein as well as my carbs though. They are shown in graph form, but not in grams. I look forward to future updates, but really like what the app does for me now.

title: So helpful
body: I tried the Atkins app for managing a low-carb diet. The problem I had with that one is that wasn't enough editing features. This app is perfect if you make a mistake and put in the wrong number or put things on the wrong day you can go back and edit anything. This is very helpful and making dieting that much easier. The last thing somebody wants to go through when they're going through sugar withdrawal is more complications and stress. Thanx 😄

title: Old version good new is better
body: I use this daily. One reason I love the new version is because it has predict when looking for foods. It also has some other features such as an exercise log that calculates calories. Being able to save your favorite foods is also a good feature. It was in the old version also but seems better this time. Overall, they have added some really nice features to an already excellent program.

title: Excellent carb tracker!
body: Super helpful app! I've been using this app for a couple weeks and really like it. It's thorough, easy to use, the barcode scanner is convenient and quick. I'm learning a lot about carbs in my diet. I also like the daily total nutrient info. I discover more features as I become more familiar with the app. Today I discovered how to find the nutritional value of individual foods (tap the i that is to the top right side of the food you have selected). Highly recommend this app.

title: Could be better.
body: I have been using this for over a month and in some ways it's great. I love the way when you plug in your foods it takes it right to a pie chart to see exactly what your fat/ protein/ carb ratios are for instance. The one thing that is driving me nuts is when you are searching for foods the order makes no sense and is frustrating. For instance; search for beef and it starts with beef salad, beef jerky, beef curry, ect. Takes a lot of searching and not even alphabetical. Also has lots of prepared foods which are not on my diet anywhere. Food lists could make much better sense.

title: Great even for beginners
body: Used this app regularly for 2 months in the fall and did awesome tracking and staying within my carbs helping jump start my weight loss. I've looked at other apps out there and like the simplicity of this one.  Sure it's kinda hard to figure out at first, but any diet tracking app is until you get used to it. Tracking definitely helps with weight loss and food choices. I could see how those who do bodybuilding would like this app as well.

title: Keto-Riffic!
body: This app is great and helps me stay accountable on my keto journey. I love the pie charts and nutrient counts. Frequently eaten food buttons and Favorites help me speed right through my logging. Can't wait to get sync'd up with my Fitbit. It should be further noted that the customer service is on point here. Not only did I get speedy responses to an inquiry but two days later I received an unsolicited follow up email to let me know the issue was fixed and I was ready to proceed. I couldn't believe it! So awesome!

title: Easy to use, easy to follow.
body: This app is easy to use.  It has a lot of products already but allows you to customize everything and make your own entries. You can even upload you own pictures.  The only problem right now I can't copy items from previous days even though it use to work.  The work around is adding everything you eat regularly to your favorites list.  It will even remember the quantity you used. I'll will add I'm not using premium and I still get a lot of good features.

title: LOVE THIS APP!!!!
body: This is a GREAT app - I use it several times daily. I love the ability to add custom foods and favorites. The index is a little overwhelming at first but once you get used to using everything it's really quite simple and functional. (I do wish it were a little easier to go in and edit custom food entries once you've made them without having to delete and start over.) The graphs and pie charts are a TERRIFIC feature. All in all I'd give it am A+! Thanks!

title: Good app
body: I really like the focus on carbs as opposed to calories which is something very few apps do. For the most part it's pretty easy to use and has a decent amount of searchable foods although it could use more. I also like the Apple Watch version of the app. My only complaint is the subscription fee just to share my data with the health app. I'd rather pay a one time minimal fee to have the option (although it should be free with a paid app) than paying a ridiculous yearly fee.

title: What I've been looking for !
body: I have been doing Atkins for almost two years. I've lost and maintained my 60 lbs weight loss but now I'm trying to lose just another 15 lbs. ( the stubborn lbs )  I want to be extra diligent. I have tried my fitness pal and liked it but never got what I wanted out of it as far as carb tracking. This app is everything I've been looking for. I highly recommend it. It can be tedious to track but I believe it's worth it.

title: Fabulous!!!
body: This is THE BEST APP for anyone on a ketogenic diet. I love carb manager!! I was in ketosis, but my weight loss completely stalled - bizarrely at the same time I began high intensity workouts. Thanks to carb manager I figured out I was eating TOO MUCH protein and not enough fat! (I assumed with the gym I needed to add low carb protein shakes). I lost 2 lbs. after the first day of using it and my weight loss is back on track steady thanks to this amazing app. Seriously considering going with the premium yearly package I find this app so awesome!

title: Great app
body: I like how this integrates with the apple health app and shows calories in addition to carbs.  The barcode feature is great and there are a lot of foods in the data base.  I do wish you could repeat certain meals easily rather than enter each food one by one again.  And I wish you could delete foods from the frequently eaten list as they seem to stay there indefinitely even if you added it only once.

title: Doesn't track blood sugar numbers???
body: For some reason, this app doesn't track blood sugar numbers.

title: Gone down hill after 'updates/bug fixes'
body: This app was great until about a week or two ago when the developers did a major update/overhaul at which time I lost all my data and the app became so buggy and frustrating to use it's almost not worth it. Since the updates there hasn't been a time I opened the app and it responded as it should. Lagging issues, measurement/servings are off, even down to the easy to read pie chart being all grey and categories have no value. I'll continue to update the app regularly but honestly if it isn't turned around soon I'll just find a better app.
response: Hi there, thanks for the feedback and for using Carb Manager. We rolled out a bunch of new updates recently, including voice logging, a snap-a-pic feature, a better food database, and free recipes. There were a few hiccups which we apologize for, but everything should be ironed out now. Please contact us at support@wombatapps.com and we'll help you address any issues.

title: Issues after update
body: This app was awesome until the last update. For a few days it crashed and lagged so much it was almost unusable. That has improved but now the pie chart is always grey. That's not that big of a deal but the colors are definitely nice for quick recognition.

title: Best Carb Counter out there
body: Whoa. Wait. The review below was for the precious version before they just RUINED a wonderful app. Smh.

title: Useful app
body: I am trying to eat a ketogenic diet. This app is helpful, although the proportional although the partial numbers on the measurements are a bit weird. Most Americans would divide cups into eighths rather than tenths, so it is a little difficult to make the numbers on my food scale match up to the numbers on the app. Prior versions had a favorites list in which I could enter custom food, but I haven't found that in this version.
response: Hi there, thanks so much for the stars! To find the favorites list, please go to the food finder -> Quick Find -> Favorites. For custom foods, go to the food finder -> My Foods -> Custom. We'll definitely look into adding eighths to the wheel picker. If you have a minute, would you mind checking out the latest version and sending your feedback? Many thanks!

title: Love it!
body: This is a great app!  I agree with others regarding the food search database.  Searching for your foods can be frustrating.  It's definitely easier to input your foods and facts then search for them; just enter it right the first time as there's no edit function.  If you make an error entering in the facts, you have to delete it and start over.  The process is really easy though.  Overall, I really like it to track my carbs and calories! Definitely worth it!

title: Great app
body: I really like this app. I've had it about a week and have lost 3lbs. I used to do weight watchers and am the type of person that needs structure when trying to lose weight and this app helps. I like that they have a huge list of foods to choose from and you can create your own and add it and even make it a favorite. I have recommended this to others as well and I am sure it will help then as well.

title: Log your food and attain ketosis
body: I love this app for working with the ketogenic diet. It was challenging to figure out how to keep my fat protein and carbs in the right ratio without this app. I love looking at my progress for the day on the pie chart and the bargraph on net carbs.

title: Works as advertised
body: Solid tracking app, the database is a bit wonky giving you a lot of results before coming to what you are looking for. Cheddar cheese and bacon are down a page or 2 below soups and other recipes when searching for those items.
