title: Great app!
body: Would also like to be able to edit custom entries, and wish Nutrisystem and Atkins meals were in the database, but it's very usable and functional. I tried several and this is the one I'm happiest with. Would be a good deal at twice the price!

title: Unusable
body: Crashes every time I try to search. Complete waste of money.

title: Worth the money!!
body: Very happy with app. Great selection when it comes to finding foods and custom food entry becomes a snap after entering the first few. Give this app a few days and you won't be able to live without it. Graphs and pie charts are pretty cool too. Get to see what and how much of protien, carbs, fat your really eating. Finally, within the 2 weeks I've been using this app I've lost 12 lbs.

title: Make it easier, please
body: Please make the food easier to choose from, some of the things make no sense.

title: Arquisatex
body: It's great and yes you can modify the entry by changing proportions, then, save it as favorite

title: Great for low carbers
body: Really useful app for keeping track

title: Carbtracker
body: This app keeps me disciplined . I like it!

title: Lowcarb
body: Good app. I use it to track my lowcarb diet and it's easy and effective. Would like to see an expanded database for brand names and a way to sort items in "recently viewed."

title: Nice job
body: Works well, with a couple of hickups; when entering Grams eaten, the spinner wheels sometimes hang up for as much as a minute. After entering one food, must backup 2 screens to enter another. Also database of foods appears to be merge of several databases resulting in a lot of logical duplicates. Looking forward to next version!

title: Has potential
body: This app is good- but I'd like to see some changes like the ability to delete and edit custom entries.

title: Don't buy this app
body: Every time I try to use the food search option, the app crashes on my iPhone. So far I have been unable to use the app at all. Complete and utter waste of money.

title: Carb Manager App for iPad
body: Thanks Wombat!  A super-awesome app!  Easy to use ... And a great $$$$$$ deal.  I love the ability to add "Custom Foods" ... And the screens are well laid out.  The massive inventory of food selections is outstanding.

title: Does the trick
body: Started Atkins and need help tracking and this does the trick.  A definite YES

title: Ok
body: I agree that this is a very good app, I am enjoying using it--for the most part--but the search is TOO SLOW and difficult to muddle through. Also, going from one screen to another takes a lot of time.

title: I like this app
body: I use this app to help me stay on track for a low carb diet (similar to Atkins) and am finding it very useful and informative.  I really like the graphs.  Definitely worth the $2.99 I paid for it.

title: Has potential...
body: The concept is good, however... When searching for foods it is very SLOW. Actually the whole program seems to load everything slowly. Also, I could not get the fractional portions to work. I will be eager for an update to try again later. It would be nice if you could save a custom meal rather than just individual food items. The food database seems comprehensive.

title: The best yet!
body: I have been using a variety of carb trackers to control my legally blind diabetics carb intake and I love this app. The best yet. 5 stars from me.

title: Great app but PRO needs this one thing
body: I love that you can integrate the health app so it can take into account calories burned throughout the day. The only problem is it does nothing with this info. You can view net calories by going into nutrition and goals but I want to be able to track net calories on the nutrition wheel. Seeing I have eaten 2000 but have to remember to subtract my Calories burned is a nuisance. My fitness pal integrates this into their app and also allows you program what macros those calories will be allocated to. So if I need to eat an extra 400 calories because I worked out I can say I want a 60/35/5 split. Please add this feature.

title: Terrible update
body: This was a great app until the update on 6/27/17. Now I can not add foods to my daily intake for some reason. Worked and now it just stopped??
response: Hi there, we're sorry for the problem yesterday. We had a server outage, but we're back online now!

title: Used to love it, now I hate it
body: Update 7/1/2017:  Thank you for fixing some of the issues. Now there's another fairly massive problem: since the upgrade, it seemed like suddenly I was eating an awful lot of fat. I tracked this down to the Trader Joe's shredded pepper jack that I have for breakfast. I went back to check the nutritional information in the app. The fat grams were skyhigh. So I rescanned the barcode, and the fat grams and other nutritional values were completely wrong when compared to the actual information on the package.
response: Hi nwnaiad, thanks for the feedback. The ounces / grams option can be found in the serving sizes dropdown. It's now available for all foods in the database. We've added lots of serving sizes, so you might need to scroll down the list. We're rapidly adding sugar alcohols, but if you find a food without one, you can set them yourself without creating a custom food by tapping the ... button and Quick Edit. We get in touch at suppor@wombatapps.com if you have any other questions.

title: I love this App! :)
body: I'm so thankful I found this app....it's incredibly easy to use and helps me so much on my weight loss journey!  I love the bar code feature that allows me to scan items at the grocery store to find out their carb rating, as well as the graph that shows me my progress. I also love that I can add custom items and recipes to follow my macros.  This is my very favorite App on my phone! 😊
response: Hi Julie, wow - thank you for the awesome review! It's an honor to be your favorite app! We'd love to hear an update on your progress. Please check out the latest version and let us know what you think! All the best, Team CM.

title: Kept me on track!
body: I just love this app. It has every food that I needed to log in the five months I've been watching my carbs. It's one of the reasons I've lost 40 pounds so far. Many more foods are listed than on other apps I've tried. Simple to use too!
response: Hi there, thanks for the review! Wow - 45 pounds - congratulations! That's really awesome and makes our day to hear. Glad that you are liking the food database. We've been working on expanding it every day. Would love for you to check out the latest version and let us know what you think. Best wishes for continued success!

title: Great features but annoyingly slow!
body: Great features but annoyingly slow!

title: @keto_in_the_city
body: I love Carb Manager, I have used it ever since I started my keto journey 20 months ago! I recommend it all the time to my IG keto friends 👍🏽😊
response: Hi Keto! Thanks for the awesome review. It makes our day to hear about your success, and also that you've been spreading the word about Carb Manager. Best of luck on your low carb journey. And if you get a chance, check out the latest version (6.0.2) and post your feedback for all to see!

title: Valuable asset/can't do Keto without it
body: I've been using the app for about 6 weeks. I like that you've updated the counter so I can see what I have left in each group.    The main reason I gave a 4 is because the app isn't available in the Android market.  I would love to be able to use my cellphone, instead of just my iPad. It would be more efficient if I could calculate my numbers at all times.
response: Hi there, thanks for great review! We have great news -- this app is available on all platforms now, and will sync seamlessly. Check it out! And if you have a minute, check out our latest version and let us know what you think. Many thanks and best wishes, Team CM.

title: Wants more money
body: It wants to charge a $39.99 1 year subscription fee for me to connect my Fitbit and enter my own recipes. Wish I could be refunded my money!

title: Great app!
body: This app has everything I need for a successful low carb & ketosis lifestyle. The bar code scanning option is excellent. I also love that it breaks down my macros.

title: Pretty good
body: It took me a little time to figure out how to use the features on this app. Used to use MFP but there's some weird virus or malware that freaked me on that app. Deleted it for this one instead. Wish the weight chart was better and that it would tell you how much weight you've lost from starting weight. Love the bar code scanner but find searches for food difficult to find the exact product I want.

title: Makes it so easy
body: My favorite part is the code scanner

title: Nice app for managing carbs!
body: I've been using Carb Manager for a couple months now and like this app. The more you use it the easier it is to find frequently used data. I especially like being able to scan a bar code and have all the nutritional info automatically loaded. There were some bugs after the program was updated last week but it looks like it's working well now.

title: Very useful
body: I have used this app every meal and find it very useful managing what I eat everyday and nutritional value. I do forget to record the water I drink. I would like to be able to add the vitamins I take each day. If there is place for that I haven't found it. I will try and scan the code and see if that works.

title: Update made the app USELESS!
body: This was my absolute fav app until the update! It is absolutely not usable now! Philadelphia Original Cream cheese - bar code & 1 oz has over 5000 cal 27 net carbs! Several ways or searching: 1 oz - 2 carbs & 57 cal or 98 cal & 2 carbs? Package says 100 cal & <1 carb per oz. The closest thing I can log is one square inch to get the #s I need for 2 oz! WHAT? Also much more difficult to actually maneuver around the app. UPDATED to add, newest update and it is WORSE!
response: Hi there, please contact us at support@wombatapps.com and we'll help you fix the issue. Thanks!

title: Watch out- you'll subscribe to premium
body: Ok app for carb counting. Watch those fingers or you'll end up subscribing to premium which is a RIP OFF for $39.99.  Complete rip off.  Did not get the "warning" courtesy button, like "are you sure you want to subscribe?" Like you do with other apps.  Sneaky way for them to steal $40 bucks from you. That is messed up. Impossible to get a refund.  Look elsewhere for carb counting or do it on your own.  After a few weeks you WILL get good at counting.
response: Hi there, if you accidentally signed up for Premium, please contact us at support@wombatapps.com and we'll ensure that you get a refund. Note that if you didn't receive an invoice you may be in a free preview mode, for which you aren't being charged.

title: Very good. Would like more restaurant recipe info.
body: I really like this app.  The basic version is good, but limits you on bar code scans. The premium package offer lots of extras that are worth the money.

title: Love this app!
body: I don't have to do much thinking. It has a beautiful pie chart, a forum that's just getting started. I can pre- add in what I may want to eat and see if I will be going over my nets for the day. I wouldn't be able to stay on track without it. The bar code reader is wonderful! Thank you!

title: Bait and switch
body: Worthless without the annual subscription upgrade, another $19.99.

title: Low Carb Tracking
body: I love this app. Doing the low carb way of life and watching my macros to drop a few pounds is way easier using this tool. I really love the bar code scanner to easily scan new foods and add to my favorite. I would give it a 5 star but everything can use improvements. I'd like to see added features like adding your workout routines from a list of gym equipment or floor exercises that counted your calorie burn. I know other apps do that but I'd like to see one app that does it all. Even allow grocery list and recipes that counted calories for the day as you added each meal. Am I asking too much? Hope to see it one day but for now I'll stick with this app. Thanks

title: A long way to go!
body: Bought this as a possible kerogenic alternative to My Fitness Pal. BOY does this app have a long way to go!! The bar code reader doesn't recognize even common national brands let alone local ones. Trying to manually enter brands / meal choices brings no results. Guess I'll be staying with Fitness Pal it's still the best even if it's carb centric.

title: Good breakdown, but the rest could be smoother
body: Good breakdown of nutrients, which is what I got it for, but everything else is frustrating. Can't add a previously eaten meal, and I'm tired of having to scan a bar code for a food that I scanned earlier the same day (I guess I have to remember to add EVERY single thing I scan to Favorites? Sigh). VERY tedious.

title: Inconsistent
body: Updated 10/21/16

title: Bait and switch with purchases
body: This app seems really good on the surface, and the 2.99 price tag you would hope would get you access to more than what other apps do for free. You basically can't do anything in the app without signing up for a yearly $19.99 membership.

title: Great all around
body: For me, this is the best carb/ nutrition app out there. It's got a ton of info, bar code scanner and is easy to personalize.

title: Fast, easy, helpful
body: A huge list of foods to choose from plus handy bar code scanner; saves favorites; does the math so I don't have to. It's been indispensible as I start my first low-carb diet.

title: $40.00 per year to connect the app to HealthKit?
body: This was the perfect app until I got the pop up asking me to confirm the charge. $40/year to connect to HealthKit is beyond crazy. That should be stated prominently in the app's description.

title: BE CAREFUL
body: I paid for the app which looked promising, however, during the set up process I was scammed into a yearly subscription as well for $39.99 .

title: Easy to look up foods.
body: Love the app. I can easily look up foods from my home, restaurants or by scanning the bar code!

title: So far, love the app
body: This app is very helpful for tracking net carbs. Bar code scanner works great. Just wish it integrated with my Fitbit.

title: Health Interface Freezes
body: Bought the app and it seemed like what I was looking for. Disappointed to find out I had to pay $19.99 for it to communicate with my Apple Watch and Health app. Ok I'm serious, I'll bite. Well the app immediately froze. Downloaded it multiple times with no luck. Emailed the support people but I'm hearing they don't respond. Congrats on taking a great idea and screwing it up with bad engineering and worse customer service. DO NOT download this app if you use the health function.

title: Easy carb counting but calorie count glitch??
body: My favorite feature is the "scan bar code" on item and it brings up all the nutritional facts and plugs them in. You don't have to sit and type in each category...it does it for you. I would give 5stara possibly but I have 600 cal in so far today and used the scan bar code for all items I have eaten today, but app totals the calories to 1800. Weird???  Everything else is spot on when compared to the labels...except calorie count. Am I doing something wrong?

title: Best!!!!!
body: Love this app!! I've been searching for something like this for a long time. Love how it gives me the break down of everything, fat vs.protein to help with a Keto diet!! ❤️❤️

title: Don't waste your time or money
body: I downloaded this app and paid the $19.99 premium. I've had it for less than 24 hours and have yet to enter anything in because it freezes on every screen. I tried multiple times to make this work, but this was a total waste of time and money.

title: Don't click on premium
body: Don't click on any options that are in premium unless you want to buy it. It will not let you back out and continues to ask you to buy the premium app for 19.99. I had the delete the app and reload it. It was the only way to get out. Other than that problem I like the app.

title: Basic and charge for calculator
body: This app is way too basic looking and you get charged 19.99 after paying 2.99 to calculate macros. It should be a free app if you are going to charge to do anything in the app.

title: Love this app!!
body: Love this app so far! I was looking for an app that tracked net carbs along with fat and protein since Im living a Keto lifestyle. I saw this one and thought I would give it a try. It's only been a couple of days but so far it has had everything I've wanted to track! I love the bar code scanner! Super simple! It does cost 2.99 but I think it's totally worth it! Would definitely recommend!

title: Excellent.
body: I have been using another app for tracking my carbs for about 3 years.  I am always looking for a better app and haven't found one until now!  I think this is hands down the best app in so far as function ability, interface, and ease of use.  I don't see how it could be any better.  Well... There is one thing.  There is a premium version, which I would like but it is not a flat fee.  It is $19.95 a year.  For me, personally, I'm not going to pay an annual fee.  That is not to say it's not worth it, but it is just not for me.

title: Vandorme
body: Just started using & so far pretty good.  It did take me s few minutes to figure out how to add the food.  Really like the bar code scanning.

title: Trying to use this
body: The bar code scanner will not work! I have sent messages in the contact section and sent an email. No response ever. It is not easy to use. You have to switch screens for different food entries. Does not track your daily % of protein limits for Atkins. Would not buy this.

title: Don't pay the 19.99.
body: So the free version was ok but it said in order to sync with my jawbone and Fitbit I needed to pay the subscription fee.  I was looking for one place to integrate all the information I use daily for my health so I bought it.  And then I get the instruction that I have to use the Apple health app basically to go between and in order to do this I had to BUY two more apps to allow this sync.  It tells you one of them is free, but it isn't.  So I decided to try it.  If it worked it would be worth it.  There is zero difference in what I was getting for FREE!  I still have to go to the health app to get any information.  And my free food tracking app is actually putting all the same info there.  I have written and asked them to help me figure out what my advantage in paying is.  No response.  Honestly.  I want my money back. This is a waste.

title: Great net carb tracker
body: I can set the Macros how I want, the bar code scanner is helpful, and it gives you net carbs...perfect for what I need.

title: Purchase this, but you still need that!
body: I hate when you purchase something that you think is the full version and then it's not. Guess that explains the in-app purchase beforehand. Let's just sell a partial app! I don't know how great the app is, as I'd rather not spend $22.99 to find out. Pen and paper cost $2 at the  dollar store.

title: Everything I need
body: Love the bar code scanner.

title: Good app, but silly to pay for extras
body: The tracker,itself, is pretty good. I like the fact that it is detailed and uses a pie chart. What I do not like is the fact to use it with your Health app, add friends, and track your water intake you need to pay a premium of $19.99/annually. One of the perks (for me) of having a tracker is having friends as accountability partners and cheerleaders. Without this service, it is only a mediocre app. I truly couldn't care less about the water tracking, but I think people should know. If these things were included with the purchase of the app, I'd definitely raise the ratings. I smell a new update coming out...

title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
body: Just started using the app a day or so ago and I LOVE it thus far!!! It's better than any other carb counting app I've used; even Atkins. They have a TON of exercises already stored in the app. It gives you a daily analysis to let you know how you did for the day. The scanner actually works! I love it so much that I went ahead and bought the annual app for $19.99!

title: Ripoff
body: Paid 2.99 for the app. Excited to start tracking my Carb intake. We'll have to pay another 19.99 a year to actually do that. Would been nice to know that going into it. App might be all I want but I'm afraid to pay the 19.99 to only find out I have to pay more for something else.

title: Watch out!!
body: Works great until you get stuck on the upgrade page. I thought about upgrading but won't now that I've had to erase and reinstall. Everything I input was lost.have to rescan and determine nutrition units all over again. Thanks programmers! You should be forced to use the program!

title: Great Customer Support
body: I like this app, it has some great features and calculates more than just Carbs. This could be a good all in one app. Here is the catch...the app is 2.99 if you want it to REALLY work for you and to link to the Health App it is an additional 19.99 a year.

title: Love it!
body: This is so well put together that it makes carb counting fun. I upgraded to the 19.99 per year and it's amazing. I can't believe how awesome the bar scanner is too. Carb counting is so much better than calorie counting. Last night I needed a little snack and I was already at 30 carbs so I just had a stick of cheese. :) perfect! I love that I can log water, favorite foods, nutrients are automatically logged- the whole thing is just GREAT! I can stay on track!! Thank you!!

title: Don't recommend it
body: I have tried multiple food trackers and purchased this one because someone highly recommend it. I don't understand why an app would have a bar code scanner if it does not work. The app will tell you that it does not support it ??

title: Annoying
body: Great concept for app but can only see half of the screen at a time and have to toggle back and forth. Super annoying. There is a $19.99 annual fee to "upgrade" and perhaps that would fix the issue? But I'm not paying $20 to count carbs😳

title: Love this app
body: I like this app. I like the bar code feature. I am on the Atkins diet. It helps me to think of the amount of carbs ad amount of money I have to spend that day. If I only have 30 carbs to spend I have to budget it throughout the day. I would recommend this app.

title: Easy To Use
body: I like how the app is easy to use and counts the carbs. I upgraded and glad I did. My favorite use for the app is the bar code scanner. Sure cuts down on the time of inputting my food log.

title: App is not always correct on net carbs
body: I had to delete this app.  Doesn't provide the correct net carbs for all Atkins food even when using the bar code scanner.

title: Great!!!!
body: Perfect for keeping track of carbs, calories and what you are actually eating. I love the bar code scanner. A must-buy.

title: Great tool
body: Works great easy to navigate and keep track so far no glitches

title: User
body: Really like the bar code scan feature!

title: Disappointing
body: I've used this app for 10 minutes and I already want my money. It isn't as user friendly as most all of the other calorie counter apps. They didn't even have kashi blueberry waffles. Or fage yogurt. It would be much more useful if it had a bar scanner and better search selection, and food input. :(

title: Lost everything! Good luck...
body: Worked great until the App disappeared along with all my saved data - major pissed!

title: Great but could be even better
body: Great app but needs a bar code scanner to make it perfect!

title: Worse than horrible
body: No way to scan barcodes. I thought it would be better than the actual Atkins carb.counter that kept freezing or would not allow favorites to be added to certain groupings. I want a refund!!

title: Good but would be Great if...
body: This app had a bar code scanner as well as some sort of work out tracker (calories/fat/carbs burned) to get a more accurate of intake/burn off.

title: Great app!
body: Only improvement I would recommend would a bar code scan feature to log in food! Other than that the app is perfect!

title: Losing weight !
body: Very easy to use. It does need a bar code scanner so I can scan codes on Atkins bars and enter on my daily intake. I have lost ten pounds so far and counting......

title: Great but could be greater
body: If you want to track your carbs, this is a fantastic app. But it really could be better.

title: Great tool
body: Very easy to use, loaded with very common products, helps stay on track

title: Keeping track
body: I like keeping track of what I eat. It makes me accountable.
